At Collins Aerospace, we’re dedicated to relentlessly tackle the toughest challenges in our industry – all to redefine aerospace.

Created in 2018 through the combination of two leading companies– Rockwell Collins and United Technologies Aerospace Systems – we’re driving the industry forward through technologically advanced and intelligent solutions for global aerospace and defense. Every day we imagine ways to make the skies and the spaces we touch smarter, safer and more amazing than ever. Together we chart new journeys, reunite families, protect nations and save lives. And we do it all with some of the greatest talent this industry has to offer.

We are Collins Aerospace and we hope you join us as we REDEFINE AEROSPACE.

Our Avionics team advances aviation electronics and information management solutions for commercial and military customers across the world. That means we’re helping passengers reach their destination safely. We’re connecting aircraft operators, airports, rail and critical infrastructure with intelligent data service solutions that keep passengers, flight crews and militaries connected and informed. And we’re providing industry-leading fire protection and safety systems that our customers can count on when it matters most. Are you ready to learn from the most knowledgeable experts in the industry, develop the technologies of tomorrow and reach new heights in your career? Join our Avionics team today.Collins Aerospace makes modern flight possible. Of course, that wouldn’t be possible without the capabilities and technologies of our organization, as well as our engineers – a highly skilled, accomplished network that spans more than 180 sites, 24 countries and 6 Strategic Business Units (SBUs).
Our industry-leading experts are setting the standards for the aerospace industry and paving the way for the future. But as new challenges present themselves, we need fresh, creative and motivated minds to overcome these hurdles, help us break barriers and achieve new levels of innovation. Do you have what it takes to join a global, diverse organization that doesn’t shy away from big opportunities? If so, we invite you to join our ranks and create the next generation of aerospace technologies.
Together, we will nurture an engineering culture that values intellectual curiosity, risk takers and integrity. A place where we will challenge ourselves, our teams, and the status quo and where we will work to find a way – the right way – to achieve what others can only dream of.

 Conducts engineering processes and standard work, including verification and qualification procedures. Compiles and consolidates testing on diagnostic systems containing logical and mathematical solutions. Learns hardware and software standards and ensures work product adheres to these standards and business objectives of the organization are met. Conducts multidisciplinary research and collaborates with equipment designers in the planning, design, development, and utilization of electronic data processing systems for product and commercial software. Determines end user needs by analyzing system capabilities to resolve problems on program intent, output requirements and input data acquisition. Ensures hardware and software standards are met. Designs and implements build procedures that are used to support hardware and software product development and use. May develop software configuration standards for company-wide use. May train software developers in the use of configuration management tools and the implementation of software quality standards. Includes control modeling (model based design).
Qualifications

Basic Qualifications

Experience in C and C++.
This position requires a Bachelor’s degree in the appropriate discipline and less than 3 years of relevant experience.In the absence of a degree, 4 years of relevant experience is required.

fields.post_html_body:
Job Description

New Grad – Digital Sales Centre – Digital Sales Associate 

(VMware Academy 2020). 

Location: Barcelona, Spain

Start date: 20th July 2020

VMware, as industry leaders in virtualization and software-defined solutions and services, enables our customers to modernize their data centers, integrate public clouds, empower the digital workspace, and transform security. Our sales team is responsible for driving new business; ensuring clarity in messaging; increasing audience engagement; supporting and promoting corporate strategy and initiatives; and developing, improving, and executing area business plans.

Academy Overview

VMware invests for the future in our global sales organization through new hire graduate programs. The VMware Academy (VA) is an extensive new career program with three tracks: Inside Sales, Technical Services and Professional Services.

The academy involves sales, technical and product training for all participants. Beginning with a foundational approach that progresses from classroom to practice and then on the job enablement, successful participants move into a Digital Sales Role: the next step in their VMware Journey.

We're looking for people who love achieving through confidence, self-discipline, and determination. Do you live your ethics and values? Are you a positive and stimulating influence on others? Are you investing in your future now?

Role Description

Continuing to deliver the next generation of sales professionals from VMware’s Digital Sales Centre in Barcelona, Spain, our focus is building a team of graduate level Digital Sales professionals to fill future roles and support future expansion of a number of Digital Sales functions, including Internal Sales Associates and Sales Specialists with a long-term view to progress to a field sales role back in your home country.

Graduate Program Overview

If you are selected for the graduate team, you will undergo training to include participation in a variety of customer and partner facing sales activities/tasks. Development is very hands-on and practical with an emphasis on experiential learning by doing. Topics to be trained include: Fundamental Sales Skills, Distance Selling, Commercial Presentation skills, Account Management and VMware Technologies.

Typical Responsibilities For The Sales Role Are Detailed Below

After successfully completing the training period, graduates who perform competently will progress into a primary customer facing sales role as available or alternatively may support their Digital Sales team within the Sales Associate role until a future territory is made available.

The responsibilities include all duties from prospecting to closing accounts with the channel sales team and Territory Executives for the territories they support. This position requires independent and purposeful action, initiative, a sense of urgency, and the ability to make timely and responsible decisions.
Be a valued member and contributor to the EMEA Sales and Field Marketing teamsDevelop and maintain proficient knowledge of products and services, industry trends, and competitionResearch accounts, identify key players, generate interest and obtain business requirements while maintaining accurate account and contact information.Drive and continuously improve customer and channel partner experience with greater opportunity engagement and longer-term relationship buildEffectively promote VMware’s value driven suite of solutions to prospects, customers, and partner’s audiences through discovery, positioning, and objection handling.Engage timely in collaborative channel sales activities while also driving new and incremental solution adoption amongst your existing VMware customer base.Create, qualify, update, and accurately forecast opportunities within Salesforce.com through our reliable global sales methodologyComplete general territory admin duties to include special pricing forms, re-assignment management, customer/partner issues as appropriate

Graduate Team Requirements
Bachelor’s and/or Master’s degreeFluency in English and SwedishCandidates need to have graduated within 12 months from the start date (July 2020)Persistence and initiative with a track record of success in academic achievement to dateDynamic individual, keen to work and collaborate in a high-energy team dependent environment.Positive and engaging phone manner, excellent listening and interpersonal skills, strong writing skills.Inquisitive commercial interests, manner, and aptitude.Ability to manage several tasks at once and succeed in a rapidly changing environmentProficient with standard corporate productivity tools (email, voicemail, MS Office)A basic understanding of computing technology, a dedication to ongoing learning, and comfort discussing technology and business value with customersA career objective to progress to a field sales role in our field sales territories
Before you join, VMware will require you to go through a pre-employment screening process. This means that we will want to verify your details and the information you have given us to ensure your suitability for a certain role.

Category : Sales
Subcategory: Inside Sales
Experience: New Graduate
Full Time/ Part Time: Full Time
Work From Home: No

VMware Company Overview: VMware, we believe that software has the power to unlock new opportunities for people and our planet. We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Shape what’s possible today at http://careers.vmware.com.

Vmware will provide reasonable accommodation to employees who have protected disabilities consistent with local law.

          C++, C, ASIC

We are looking for the go-to person for technical support when digging into key customers' issues. A curious mind, with entrepreneurial spirit who will take ownership of recurring problems and will persist until the best possible solution is found.

On the day to day, the Revenue Operations Analyst (New Grad) will be working alongside Account Managers to maximize results for our global customers, unpicking roadblocks and providing additional support for tracking and onboarding issues in key instances in our customers life cycle.

You will own specific projects that range from identifying and diagnosing global campaign issues to designing processes that improve efficiency. Your solutions and learnings will be passed on to the team and will help shape project outlines that will be passed on to our Product and Tech teams.

So, if you like digging into technical issues and won't (or can't) stop until the right fix is found, this challenge is for you!

This position is based in Buenos Aires, Argentina at Jampp's HQ.

What you'll do
 Identify key global roadblocks and scaling challenges across +100 accounts. Help collect and troubleshoot technical problems (Tracking, Integrations, Supply, etc.). Support account managers in critical moments such as the onboarding period or when there is churn risk. Prioritise issues and projects to ensure we use resources effectively. Identify opportunities to improve actual processes to maximize efficiency. Create project outlines for tech and product to raise deeper technical issues that need greater development 

Qualifications
 SQL and Python language understanding; Experience working with this tools is a plus Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Engineering, Economics or related Familiar with Project Management methodologies Natural problem solver, data-driven and solution oriented entrepreneur. Attention to detail with a high level of accuracy in completing tasks. Fluent in Spanish and English 

What We Offer
 📱Learn a ton about the hottest area of growth in Internet advertising - Mobile! 💪🏼 An entrepreneurial environment. 🎢A high level of responsibility from day one and the chance to develop your potential without limitations. 🌎A guaranteed Global Environment! We have jamppers from 🇧🇷🇬🇧🇺🇸🇮🇪🇫🇷🇩🇪🇦🇷... our customers are not the only ones from around the globe 😉 💻Macbooks are our standard, but we're happy to get you whatever equipment helps you get your job done. 💰Competitive salary 🍿Coffee, loads of snacks and a fridge full of drinks! 😎 Cool swag and team activities. Did we mention an annual off-site? 

Who We Are

Jampp is the growth platform of choice for on-demand apps worldwide. We unlock programmatic advertising to drive incremental performance. A demand-side platform (DSP) at heart, Jampp leverages unique contextual and behavioral signals to deliver customers and in-app purchases through programmatic user acquisition and retargeting.

Simpler version; with a team of +100 mobile specialists, we simplify programmatic growth for some of the biggest mobile advertisers (like Uber, Rappi, iFood, & Takeaway.com to name a few).

We leverage diverse technologies to build our extremely scalable and highly available platform and big data tools that allow us to manage and process the big stream of data we receive. We analyze more than 100TB per day to determine (in less than 1ms) the value of an ad depending on it's probability to convert, the context of the user and other factors billions of time each hour.

We serve our global client base from our offices in San Francisco, Berlin, São Paulo, Singapore, Cape Town, and Buenos Aires.

fields.company_name: Research Scientist, Demography and Survey Science - University Grad
fields.post_html_body:
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.

The Demography and Survey Science team's mission is to improve the way we run surveys and make decisions both within and outside of Facebook. We are looking for quantitative social scientists with experience in applied research in survey methodology, statistical inference, regression modeling, exploratory data analysis, and mathematical demography. With more than a million survey responses daily, you will help teams differentiate the signal from the noise, and provide them with the information and insights they need to make better, more informed product decisions. You will enjoy getting unique access to several of the richest data sets in the world, cutting edge technology and the ability to solve novel problems and provide innovative and methodologically rigorous research across the company. The perfect candidate will have a background in a social science, quantitative or technical field and experience working with large data sets and relational databases. You are focused on results, a self-starter, and have superior analytical, computational, and communication skills. This position is based full-time in our Menlo Park, CA office.

Responsibilities
Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, survey methodology, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand how to effectively direct products to better serve their usersProvide teams with usable measurement strategies and methodologies to meet their product and business decision needsInform, influence, support, and execute research projects used throughout Facebook to drive product and company decisionsDeliver insights and recommendations clearly to relevant audiences
Minimum Qualification
Currently has or in the process of obtaining PhD. in statistics, political science, sociology, economics, demography, computational social sciences or related field, and experience with applied problems in survey researchExperience in applying at least one of the following in your research: survey methodology (e.g., bias correction, sampling and design), quantitative research methods or statistical analysis, regression modeling, causal inference with a survey outcome, shrinkage and regularization, designing and analyzing longitudinal panel surveys, behavioral data analysisExperience with data analysis using tools such as R or Python and with SQLExperience initiating and driving research projects to completion with minimal guidanceExperience communicating the results of analysesMust obtain work authorization in country of employment at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment

Preferred Qualification
Experience with large data sets and distributed computing (Hive/Hadoop)Experience with Bayesian statistical modelsExperience with primary data collectionExperience with field experiments, experimental design, missing data, survey sampling, and/or panel dataExperience with observational causal inference (e.g., regression adjustment, matching, propensity score stratification), or quasi-experimental methods (e.g., instrumental variables, regression discontinuity, interrupted time series)Experience with bandit optimization, adaptive experimentation, and/or Gaussian processes

Honey is a fast-growing startup based in Los Angeles. Our online shopping platform offers users a smarter way to shop. Through a simple browser extension, we open up instant access to exclusive savings, deals, rewards, and discovery, all powered by the collective knowledge of Honey's community of online shoppers. We are helping millions save when they shop online, and we're hiring! We are actively seeking a University Recruiter to join our Talent Team.

About The Team

As a member of the University Recruiting team, you will help build and scale our Internship and New Grad programs. We are a small but mighty team that is focused on bringing in the next generation of talent. We care deeply about building diverse teams, providing an excellent candidate experience, and hiring the best entry-level talent for Honey.

About The Role

We are seeking a motivated individual who works well with ambiguity and is always up for a challenge. In this role, you will build and own the campus strategy for East Coast schools, execute on recruiting events, and grow Honey's brand on campus. You will also do full-cycle recruiting for interns and new grads, and manage our conversion process. You will partner closely with the engineering team and engineering leadership to ensure we are consistently improving our program. You must be a builder who thrives in a learning environment, is unafraid to try new things, embrace new ideas, and welcome suggestions for how we can iterate on our processes. You will be constantly challenged to think creatively on how to drive hiring results.

What You’ll Do

As a University Recruiter at Honey, you will:
 Design school-specific strategies that enhance our brand on campus and attract top talent, including developing deep relationships with faculty, students, and student-run organizations Manage the full-cycle recruiting process for new graduate and intern candidates for our software engineering and product teams, including sourcing, screening, and interviewing candidates for requirements and company values fit, maintaining candidate relationships, creating and extending offers, and closing candidates Create a positive experience for students at the recruiting stage and throughout their internship, including onboarding, performance evaluation, and conversion process Build and iterate on our year-round internship program alongside teammates and cross-functional stakeholders  Effectively communicate the value and the brand of the program to internal stakeholders Assist with tracking key metrics and reports to analyze the success of the program 

About You

(Preferred, not Required)
 A minimum of 1-2 years of full-cycle university recruiting experience in a fast-paced, high-growth environment A passion for building diverse teams and delivering an exceptional candidate experience Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with an appropriate blend of professionalism and friendliness A growth mindset and truly flexible. You can shift tasks and priorities as needs change. Ability and willingness to travel up to 40% during peak recruiting cycles and work flexible hours as needed Ability to operate independently and make decisions  Consistent attention to detail while operating with a sense of urgency 

Nice-to-Have Qualifications
 Proficiency with Greenhouse and Handshake Willingness to own other programs or ad-hoc projects, as needed Experience with recruiting for technical roles  

At Honey, we are committed to building a diverse and inclusive company. We seek to create a culture where everyone can belong because we believe that people do their best work when they can show up every day as their authentic selves. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives.

Honey is an equal opportunity employer. We do not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or genetic information, in compliance with applicable federal, state and local law.

fields.company_name: Rotational Production Network Engineer, University Grad
fields.post_html_body:
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.

Facebook is looking for talented, highly motivated university graduates for our Rotational Network Engineering team. As a member of the team, you will work alongside experienced Backbone, Data Center, Production Engineers (Network) on a large-scale global network.This will be your network and it is constantly growing. Your primary function will be to ensure that the network and its related services are reliable, robust and can scale to meet the challenges that serving over a billion users presents. Automation and continuous improvement are the keys to meeting our demands; you will be responsible for developing and deploying network designs, automation systems and network performance improvements into our production network.Do you feel that you can do more than what your network's growth allows? Do you want to solve problems that can only be seen in large scale environments? Do you want to work on one of the most dynamic, fast-paced networks in the world? Do you want to develop innovative solutions to our challenges and ship them into production? Then this is the role for you!

Responsibilities
Build experience with Backbone, Data Center, and Production Engineering (Network) teams through rotational experiences during your 6 to 12 monthsBuild, manage and maintain multi-vendor, multi-protocol data center, backbone and edge networksDevelop optimized network monitoring systemsDesign and deploy new network architectures and related toolingDevelop automated methods to mitigate and remediate network eventsAnalyze data to diagnose and identify root causes to network issuesBe an active participant in deep technical discussionsDevelop and maintain consistency within the network infrastructure
Minimum Qualification
Experience scripting/coding in one or more higher-level languages (e.g., Python, C++, Go, etc.)Experience with network device configurationExperience with Linux/UnixKnowledge of TCP/IPAnalytical and troubleshooting experienceMust obtain work authorization in the country of employment at the time of hire, and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment

Preferred Qualification
Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Network Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or a related fieldKnowledge of Switching and Routing concepts and implementationProtocol knowledge in one or more of BGP, MPLS, ISIS or similar routing protocols - knowledge in typical configurations and performance tuningKnowledge of tunneling protocols MPLS, GRE, IPnIPKnowledge of TCP/IP and IPv6

We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

Software Developer – Career Change 
 Gloucester 
Do you want to work for a team that makes a difference? Do you want to work with a company whose world class prevention of cyber-crime has secured the future of financial services institutions across the UK? This client is investing in your future as a Software Developer. They work on National security projects and are enrolling you on a 2 year course that gives you the chance to learn new programming languages. The first 6 months will be heavily training based and then you will be put through a DV level clearance. These are not grad roles, we are looking for people who have some personal experience programming and are interested in getting involved with national security. 
  “We all have a role to play in defending our clients, and this is yours” 
 The role As a Software Developer you will be: Working on high security project in national security whilst going through the DV process Providing consulting services to clients around the South west of England Available immediately – you will be starting in January therefore interviews will take place immediately We are also welcoming people looking for a change in careers or people who’ve been out of work for whatever reason 
 The Requirements In order to be considered for this role the Software Developer must: Have some coding experience with either C++, C#, Python or Android Eligible for DV level clearance – please call for more details 
 The benefits The business is offering a salary of £32,000. Along with this you also get a DV Bonus of 10% each year, and a £3K bonus on completion of the course. If this sounds like something you might be interested in then Apply Now! 
Location: Gloucester   Role: Software Developer   Job type: 2 year Training course   Salary: £32K + Bonus Contact: Cara Harkin Reference: *AMC*CHK/PSDBG

Are you a student or new grad looking to gain real world experience in the self driving industry? We’re looking for interns who are passionate about our mission to accelerate the adoption of safe autonomous driving by providing highly scalable and accurate HD Maps and Localization as-a-service. At DeepMap, you will be surrounded and learning from industry veterans with deep experience from top companies such as: Google, Apple, Uber, Tesla, Baidu, LinkedIn, among others.

We Have Several Types Of Internship Roles

Computer Vision Engineering: Gain exposure and hands-on experience designing, benchmarking and implementing algorithms & methods using point cloud and image data within focus areas such as: Deep Learning and Object Detection, SLAM/Localization, Sensor Fusion and Calibration, and/or 2D/3D data processing and analysis.

Software Engineering: Get experience working on complex and production level systems across teams such as Map Engine, AV Client, and/or Tools. Projects can range from low level embedded software to front and backend web technologies. Technologies include: Linux based C++, Java, Python, Javascript.

Infrastructure Engineering: Learn and work on the backbone of our services. Design, develop, and improve scalable internet service infrastructure software. Automate and streamline operations and process. Troubleshoot and resolve issues in both development and production environments. Technologies include: AWS, Go, Java, SQL, MapReduce.

Requirements
 Soon to be or new graduates in Computer Science or related field a plus Proficient in one or more the following languages: C/C++ (required), Java, Python Experience with point cloud or image processing is a plus

At Collins Aerospace, we’re dedicated to relentlessly tackle the toughest challenges in our industry – all to redefine aerospace.

Created in 2018 through the combination of two leading companies– Rockwell Collins and United Technologies Aerospace Systems – we’re driving the industry forward through technologically advanced and intelligent solutions for global aerospace and defense. Every day we imagine ways to make the skies and the spaces we touch smarter, safer and more amazing than ever. Together we chart new journeys, reunite families, protect nations and save lives. And we do it all with some of the greatest talent this industry has to offer.

We are Collins Aerospace and we hope you join us as we REDEFINE AEROSPACE.

Our Avionics team advances aviation electronics and information management solutions for commercial and military customers across the world. That means we’re helping passengers reach their destination safely. We’re connecting aircraft operators, airports, rail and critical infrastructure with intelligent data service solutions that keep passengers, flight crews and militaries connected and informed. And we’re providing industry-leading fire protection and safety systems that our customers can count on when it matters most. Are you ready to learn from the most knowledgeable experts in the industry, develop the technologies of tomorrow and reach new heights in your career? Join our Avionics team today.Collins Aerospace makes modern flight possible. Of course, that wouldn’t be possible without the capabilities and technologies of our organization, as well as our engineers – a highly skilled, accomplished network that spans more than 180 sites, 24 countries and 6 Strategic Business Units (SBUs).
Our industry-leading experts are setting the standards for the aerospace industry and paving the way for the future. But as new challenges present themselves, we need fresh, creative and motivated minds to overcome these hurdles, help us break barriers and achieve new levels of innovation. Do you have what it takes to join a global, diverse organization that doesn’t shy away from big opportunities? If so, we invite you to join our ranks and create the next generation of aerospace technologies.
Together, we will nurture an engineering culture that values intellectual curiosity, risk takers and integrity. A place where we will challenge ourselves, our teams, and the status quo and where we will work to find a way – the right way – to achieve what others can only dream of.

Role Overview
This position is for a entry-level Software Engineering professional responsible for software engineering processes and activities. Consolidates test results and conducts single disciplinary research, applying hardware and software standards.

Primary Responsibilities
 Conducts engineering processes and standard work, including verification and qualification procedures. Compiles and consolidates testing on diagnostic systems containing logical and mathematical solutions. Assists in conducting disciplinary research on one or more stages of the equipment design phase to develop design options and recommendations. Learns hardware and software standards and ensures work product adheres to these standards and business objectives of the organization are met. Designs, develops, documents, tests and debugs control and diagnostic systems that contain logical and mathematical solutions. Conducts multidisciplinary research and collaborates with equipment designers in the planning, design, development, and utilization of electronic data processing systems for product and commercial software. Determines end user needs by analyzing system capabilities to resolve problems on program intent, output requirements and input data acquisition. Ensures hardware and software standards are met. Designs and implements build procedures that are used to support hardware and software product development and use. May develop software configuration standards for company-wide use. May train software developers in the use of configuration management tools and the implementation of software quality standards. Includes control modeling (model based design).
Qualifications

Preferred Qualifications:

Basic Qualifications

Candidates for this role should possess a Requires theoretical knowledge typically obtained through University Degree.
Requires a Bachelor's Degree or three years of prior relevant experience.

At Collins, the paths we pave together lead to limitless possibility. And the bonds we form – with our customers and with each other -- propel us all higher, again and again.

Some Of Our Competitive Benefits Package Includes
 Medical, dental, and vision insurance Three weeks of vacation for newly hired employees Generous 401(k) plan that includes employer matching funds and separate employer retirement contribution Tuition reimbursement Life insurance and disability coverage And more
Apply now and be part of the team that’s redefining aerospace, every day.

Copy LinkApply Now
At WillowTree, we bring our clients' ideas to life - in a digital sense.
We believe teams of mixed disciplines and diverse perspectives create the best work places.
And our Test Engineering team is vital to WillowTree, our clients and products.
They start with why.
They want to understand our clients' needs, product and business goals, and pain points.
They look for ways to break software with intent (always).
And they're really good at turning complex (sometimes messy) code into organized, efficient, usable products.
WillowTree's current clients include HBO, Nestle, Allianz, General Electric, Fox Sports, PepsiCo, and more. Our commitment to fostering an environment that encourages creativity has been rewarded by Fortune, Great Places to Work and Glassdoor as the best workplace in tech. Check out what others are saying about us.
Our Software Test Engineers are embedded into our project teams. They work on a wide array of projects and platforms for our clients to ensure we're shipping quality applications.
Your Impact
 You'll build an exciting career by exploring testing on multiple technical platforms (iOS, Android, Web, etc.) Your day-to-day work will influence millions of users You'll have the opportunity to be mentored by engineering leadership You'll participate in the delivery of large and complex software projects in a team-based environment You'll provide critical analysis and feedback necessary to confidently deliver high-quality software
Your Background
 You plan to graduate in December 2019 or May 2020 You have experience with one or more programming languages You have experience working with others on projects of varying sizes and complexities You're willing to learn and advocate for Test Engineering methodology and best practices You have an inquisitive mind and an eye for detail You're willing to dig deeply into how things work You aren't afraid to speak up if something isn't working correctly You're able to prioritize and manage your workload You love to identify problems and brainstorm solutions
Bonus Points
 You have previous experience in creating, executing, and documenting test plans in the software development lifecycle You are familiar or have had exposure with native or cross-platform test automation frameworks for mobile and web apps (e.g. XCTest UI, Espresso, Selenium, Appium) You've worked on agile teams in new product development
P.S. In an ideal world, you hit all the bullet points we listed, but hey - we know that's a lot of bullets. If you feel confident about a good amount of them, we can ramp you up on the rest.
Why WillowTree?
We offer a place to be yourself.
Our differences, both visible and invisible, benefit our teams, our communities, and the products we craft. That's why WillowTree strives to build a team with diverse backgrounds, skills, and perspectives. You'll work hard here; however, we'll balance that with a culture that supports your growth and cares about your well-being. We're committed to creating an environment of inclusion - a place where every Tree can thrive.
We want you to reach your fullest potential and part of your professional development at WillowTree will include mentorship, dedicated time to innovate, and an annual stipend to fund your professional pursuits.

Our "more human, less corporate" culture is built around doing work that matters, winning as a team and celebrating success. The Opportunity

Shutterstock is a leading global technology company that offers high-quality assets, tools and services through our creative platform. This platform inspires creators throughout the world by providing diverse content to businesses, marketing agencies and media organizations around the world. The people behind the scenes are a super talented, fiercely passionate group of individuals with the unified goal of working together to build a stronger company for our customers, contributors and colleagues alike.

The Planning Intern position is a new role that will help build forecast models, analyze performance of marketing initiatives, and track campaign spend and expenses against budgets. With the Planning Manager, you will evaluate forecasting models and their outputs across all content-types (image, video, music, and editorial) and eCommerce & Enterprise sales distribution channels. The goal of this program is to provide the most accurate predictions of business performance across each marketing channel as well as recommendations where spend can be allocated more efficiently. The ideal candidate is very analytical and has a natural tendency to dig deep into the data to uncover trends and insight. You must also have a keen interest in marketing and optimizing large marketing budgets to hit key business objectives. Additionally, you enjoy working cross-functionally across an organization to make and realize critical business decisions.

Note: This position is a part of our Marketing organization, reports to the Planning Manager, and is based out of Shutterstock’s New York headquarters in the Empire State Building. This role is for Summer 2020, June 1st-August 28th.

Responsibilities
  Manage and lead a project for the summer and present to executives your findings.   Help optimize forecast models that measure and track the output of all marketing spend (ROI, CAC, LTV, Revenue) and update regularly as inputs and market conditions change.   Track marketing spend across the organization and report on pacing vs budgets.   Provide monthly, quarterly, and ad hoc reporting needs as it relates to budgeting.   Identify trends in performance, spend, and product usage that can be used as inputs to various forecasting models and influential factors to how campaigns are being setup and executed.   Work with channel owners and provide opportunities to move spend to higher performing campaigns based on region, keyword set, copy, and any additional leading segment.  

Requirements
  Rising senior (or recent grad), pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Finance, Marketing, Business, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics or related field.   Comfortable working with large, complex, and disparate data sets -- strong Excel skills required; SQL or other database/ query skills preferred.   High attention to detail with the ability to manage various projects across different teams.   Thrive in a fast-paced environment and experience leading through change.   Show clear, logic-based decision-making with a sense of urgency around meeting business objectives.   Proven ability to build models, perform complex analyses and forecasting, and deliver executive-level reporting.   Knowledgeable in marketing and business KPIs.   Comfortable with different data platforms (internal reporting, web analytics platforms, 3rd party marketing platforms).   Familiar with digital marketing channels, different attribution models, and B2B and B2C marketing programs.   Familiar with eCommerce and Enterprise business models and marketplaces.   Strong communication and collaboration skills with a proven track record of communicating strategies, building business cases and plans, and selling these across a matrix organization.   Operate successfully in a cross-functional environment -- partner and work directly with other marketing stakeholders, business, sales, and finance teams.  

About Shutterstock

Shutterstock, Inc. (NYSE: SSTK ), directly and through its group subsidiaries, is a leading global provider of high-quality licensed photographs , vectors , illustrations , videos and music to businesses, marketing agencies and media organizations around the world. Working with its growing community of over 1 million contributors, Shutterstock adds hundreds of thousands of images each week, and currently has more than 297 million images and more than 16 million video clips available.

Headquartered in New York City, Shutterstock has offices around the world and customers in more than 150 countries. The company’s brands also include Bigstock , a value-oriented stock media offering; Shutterstock Custom, a custom content creation platform ; Offset, a high-end image collection ; PremiumBeat, a curated royalty-free music library; and Shutterstock Editorial, a premier source of editorial images for the world's media.

For more information, please visit www.shutterstock.com and follow Shutterstock on Twitter and on Facebook .

Job Description

Be involved in projects with our Planning & Environment Team and be a part of a growing organization that meets our client’s objectives and solves their challenges.

At WSP, we are driven by inspiring the right people to be part of our future-focused business objectives. Our devotion to teamwork has allowed us to build communities and expand our skylines. Here at WSP, anything is within our reach- and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!

WSP is currently initiating a search for Assistant Planners for our Los Angeles, Sacramento, San Diego, and San Franscisco office.

Duties And Responsibilities
 Data collection (online and in the field) Produce maps and conduct analysis with Geographic Information Systems Conduct research and prepare reports and technical memoranda Prepare presentation materials Coordinate and attend public and stakeholder meetings 

Job Requirements

Talent is the essence of meeting our client’s objectives, goals and challenges. If this sounds like a fit for you, we’d love to have that first discussion of you joining our team.

Minimum Qualifications
 Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in accredited urban planning, geography, environmental sciences Undergraduate or Graduate program 1 year or less post graduate work experience Prior internship experience, leadership experience, or relevant coursework Experience with Microsoft Office, including Word, Excel and PowerPoint Strong technical writing, analytical and communication skills Detail-oriented with an emphasis on quality work products The selected candidate must have the ability to work in the United States immediately. 

Preferred Qualifications
 Familiarity with ESRI ArcGIS Familiarity with Adobe Creative Suite Familiarity with Census Data retrieval and analysis 

About WSP USA

WSP USA is the U.S. operating company of one of the world's leading engineering and professional services firms. Dedicated to serving local communities, we are engineers, planners, technical experts, strategic advisors and construction management professionals. WSP USA designs lasting solutions in the transportation, buildings, energy, water and environment sectors. With nearly 7,000 people in 100 offices across the U.S., we partner with our clients to help communities prosper. www.wsp.com/usa

WSP provides a progressive mix of benefits including medical, dental 401k and long term disability focused on a providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.

At WSP, we want to give our employees the challenges they seek to grow their careers and knowledge base. Your daily contributions to your team will be a key piece in our meeting client objectives, goals and challenges, are you ready to get started?

WSP USA is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Race/Color/Religion/Sex/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/National Origin and Veterans and Disability.

The selected candidate must be authorized to work in the United States.

Relocation assistance is not available for this position.

Ciena may well be the most important technology company you’ve never heard of. The innovations that wow us (driverless cars), and those we now take for granted (the ability to mobile-stream your favorite show) are the products of ingenuity from some brilliant and forward-thinking companies. But those companies rely on Ciena, another vanguard of innovation, to create and advance the underlying networks that bring their breakthroughs to our doorsteps. VR, AI, IOT, 5G … literally none of it would be possible without the mind-boggling technology that makes the internet itself work. For more than 25 years, Ciena has been the global leader in networking strategy, and our technology has been part of the critical infrastructure running within the most advanced companies in the world.
Ciena Corporation, the network specialist, offers leading network infrastructure solutions, intelligent software and a comprehensive services practice. Our portfolio of software-centric optical and Ethernet platforms combines network element programmability, operating system commonality and management unification, and Carrier Ethernet-based transformation to enable our customers to change the way they compete. Our solutions form the foundation of many of the largest, most reliable and sophisticated service provider, enterprise, government, and research and education networks across the globe.

This is an entry level position.

Job Description & Responsibilities

The 6500 is the flagship product of Ciena’s Packet Optical Transport Portfolio. Optical networks continue to aggressively move towards Layer 0/1/2 converged infrastructures. Join the 6500 team delivering these Optical Ethernet Network solutions:
 Next Generation optical transport solutions Hybrid Layer 0/1/2/3 switching (OTN/Ethernet/MPLS)
Responsibilities

This is an entry level embedded programming position with the following responsibilities

As a member of a larger team, the candidate will participate in the software development life cycle.
 Participate in C, C++ software development of new functionality in various software components. Write embedded software for devices on a real-time OS Participate in the design of various embedded software applications. Test, document, debug and maintain the applications. Participate in backlog defect reduction. Write scripts, test utilities, and other development tools.
Required Skills
 C, C++ programming language experience Real time operating systems concepts Fundamentals of structured programming and design concepts Interest and aptitude for software development is a must Enthusiasm and a willingness to learn Ability to seek out answer and work independently Independent self-starter, positive work attitude and highly motivated Strong verbal and technical writing skills Comfortable in a team environment Familiarity with Software Development Methodologies
Skills Which Are An Asset

We have multiple positions available which span a wide range of software, involving a subset of the following areas. Experience and/or knowledge in any of them is an asset:
 Familiarity with networking, datacom & telecom concepts such as DWDM, SONET/SDH, OTN, Ethernet, TCP/IP, MPLS, routing protocols Low-level Real-Time Software/Firmware Development Ability to understand software design patterns, sequence diagrams, and UML. Ability to understand CPU Hardware architectures, Hardware Functional Specifications and Hardware Timing Diagrams Linux, VxWorks Linux as a software development environment Exposure to CLI, TL1, SNMP, NETCONF, REST, gRPC. Design and development tools such as: Git, Eclipse, JIRA, Confluence, GDB, Yocto YANG modeling language and toolchains Scripting experience, Python, Go, BASH
Required Experience
 B.S. in computer/electrical/software engineering or computer science
The anticipated start date for this position is May 2020; however, we may have some earlier start dates available. You must be available for full-time employment by this date.

The following information will assist you in completing the online application:
 Be sure to attach a resume to the application (in the documents section), as well as a cover letter (if desired). Employment History can include co-op placements, internships or summer work terms while enrolled in a University/College program. Include your GPA (and what it is out of, e.g. 3.6/4.0, 80/100) in your resume. Be sure to also enter your school information in the Education Qualifications field of the application. Include any extracurricular and/or volunteer activities in your resume.
Rewarding experience. Meaningful outcomes.

Making a difference in people's lives through design and implementation of leading network technologies. That's what motivates us.

A distinct way to work

Free thinking, free discussion, and collaboration are the norm. Expect more satisfying outcomes - both personal and professional.

Ciena values the diversity of our workforce and respects its employees as individuals, regardless of race, nationality, religion, sexual orientation, gender or age.

Ciena is also committed to developing inclusive, barrier-free selection processes and work environments. If contacted in relation to a job opportunity, you should advise Ciena in a timely fashion of the specific needs / accommodation measures which must be taken to enable you to be assessed in a fair and equitable manner. Information received relating to any specific needs / accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially.

What you can expect from us
 You will receive notification of your successful application Successful applicants will be contacted by Talent Acquisition for an initial discussion If suitable you will be considered for the short list and our formal interview process

Language required: English and either Bahasa Indonesia OR Pakistan 

Business Summary

Work Here. Transform Everywhere.

98% of Fortune 500 Companies use VMware Technology!

The most advanced companies in the world turn to VMware to manage, grow and transform their business. When you work here, you’re connected to a global community of innovative, empowered employees working together to solve the most critical technology challenges.

We believe that creativity sparks innovation and inspires our employees to think differently and challenge the status quo. Whether it’s the kind of products we develop, our approach to sustainability, or how we give back to our communities, VMware finds unique ways to bring people together to fuel creative thinking. Want to know more, check out our website.

We have the journey for you!

As well as working for one of the best technology companies in the world, under the leadership of the best CEO (voted by Glassdoor), the Academy Training program is designed to fast track our new graduate hires from training into successful careers in the Worldwide Sales and Services organization. We offer you in-depth training focused on our most exciting technologies, while growing your skills throughout the progression.

Insights into your Role

The Inside Account Manager is assigned to a specific geographic area paired with a Field Account Manager. The Inside Account Manager primary role is to maximize sales in the assigned market territory through leveraging the partner sales community and teaming with the Field Account Managers and Solution Engineering team. The primary focus is aimed at sales opportunities and accounts and is achieved by engaging customers directly while collaborating with partners to identify, develop, accelerate, up-sell and close transactions. It is expected that this role will increase deal win rates as well as accelerate time to close on key opportunities. The Task includes
Working with VMware marketing, channels team in driving activities that will lead to demand generation. This includes but not limited to workshops, campaigns, call blitzs etcUtilizing VMware applications eg. SalesForce, Insidesales.com to manage, run the territory Explains technical, industry, and market facts to position VMware as a competitive solutionCooperates and collaborates with colleagues, cross-functionally, to support the sales processArticulates how the VMware business model relates to selling VMware products and servicesLearns the full range of VMware technology, products, and services and is able to identify how these products and services align to customer needs.You get to meet customer 5-10% of the time travel (to the local country once a quarter or where necessary), while rest of the time would be desk bound. 

Required Skills
Bachelor’s degree required. Proven ability to assimilate into a team environment and works in challenging teaming situationFast learner, self-motivated with a high attention to detail and ability to multitask Passionate about technology. A positive attitude, strong drive for results, and the ability to deal with ambiguity are a mustAn open mindset to new ideas and suggestions. Demonstrates good judgment in analyzing information to make decisions. Proficient with digital technology and social media

NOTE: Language Requirements for this role

English (primary business language) alongside with native language listed below (either or):

 Bahasa Indonesia Pakistan (Punjabi, Pashto, Sindhi, Saraiki and Urdu)

Preferred Skills

 Sales related working experience / exposure Account management (sales related)

We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Shape what’s possible today at http://careers.vmware.com.

JOIN OUR TEAM AND BE INVOLVED IN DEVELOPING FLIGHT CRITICAL 

 AEROSPACE COMPONENTS! 

As a Moog Aircraft Group  Systems Development Engineer  , individuals must bring a solid technical background, passion for learning and working through difficult problems, and exhibit potential for leadership in the future. A Systems Development Engineer will be a key contributor to one or more of Moog’s new development projects focused on designing, verifying, and delivering aircraft flight control actuation systems (FCAS) or weapons bay door actuation systems (WBDAS). Specific tasks may involve requirements definition, system design, integration and test, report writing, and customer briefing.

The successful candidate must be sound technically and sufficiently broad in his/her experience or interest areas to delve into complicated problems involving the interaction between mechanical, electrical, and software subsystems. Additionally, he/she must bring a demonstrated experience in solving complex problems in a collaborative team environment, preferably in an aerospace context. Applicants must be highly motivated “self-starters” willing to tackle multi-disciplinary engineering problems and “own” responsibilities that, by their nature, will require both consultation with engineering peers and self-motivated research. The successful candidate will be interested in big picture thinking and working in a multi-disciplinary environment to resolve technically challenging problems.

 Moog Aircraft Group  is the leader of advanced flight controls for commercial and military aircraft. We are positioned on virtually every aircraft in the marketplace, supplying reliable systems that are highly supportable and add significant value for our customers. Moog Aircraft Group is a sector of Moog (NYSE:MOG-A).  Moog  designs, manufactures and integrates precision motion control components and systems. Our high-performance solutions are used in satellites and space vehicles, military and commercial aircraft, launch vehicles, missiles, industrial machinery, marine applications, and medical equipment. Headquartered in East Aurora, NY, we employ over 11,500 employees in 28 countries. While we are most known for our products that are the best in the industry, what’s unique about Moog is our culture of trust and mutual respect that allows for personal initiative, autonomy and excellence.

 As a Systems Development Engineer, you will… 
 Contribute to the design, validation, and verification of a FCAS/WBDAS  Operate as member of the Systems Engineering team, within a multi-disciplinary project team  Be responsible for generating design artifacts including simulation models, design requirements, validation and verification plans and procedures, test and analysis reports  Communicate on a technical level with customer representatives and suppliers  Be proactive in asking questions, doing research, and understanding Moog’s technology  Analyze and troubleshoot problems for root cause, and be involved in implementing solutions  Learn from senior staff and apply lessons quickly and efficiently to assigned tasks  Travel to other Moog and customer sites (US based); 10-25% 
NOTE: A strong internal candidate has been identified, but others will be considered.

Minimum Qualifications To Be Considered…
 BS or MS Degree in Electrical, Mechanical, Aerospace, Computer or Systems Engineering from an accredited university, with a 3.5 GPA or higher.  Demonstrated leadership or team experience of a technical nature  Basic knowledge of Matlab/Simulink tools  Excellent verbal and written skills required  Excellent communication and people skills  Demonstrated academic success in a technical track  Must have the ability and willingness to obtain an Active DOD Secret clearance.  Due to federal contract obligations, must be a US Citizen or US Permanent Resident (Green Card Holder) 

Preferred Qualifications Include…
 Experience and advanced proficiency with Matlab/Simulink/Stateflow tools  Experience and advanced proficiency in control system design  Knowledge of hydro-mechanical and/or electro-mechanical actuation technologies  Familiarity with aircraft flight control systems  Experience in laboratory settings testing electrical/mechanical hardware  Experience coding in software/scripting languages e.g. C/C++, Python 
At Moog we work in an environment where people trust, respect and encourage one another. We believe in our people, and it shows in everything we do. We invite you to become part of our continued success.

EOE/AA Minority/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Female/Disability/Veteran

The Opportunity

Shutterstock is a leading global technology company that offers high-quality assets, tools and services through our creative platform. This platform inspires creators throughout the world by providing diverse content to businesses, marketing agencies and media organizations around the world. The people behind the scenes are a super talented, fiercely passionate group of individuals with the unified goal of working together to build a stronger company for our customers, contributors and colleagues alike.

Shutterstock’s Content Operations team is seeking a creative, self-motivated, detail-oriented, and disciplined individual to work with us as a summer intern. We’re seeking someone who is enthusiastic and eager to learn about the stock industry, licensing, review and curation standards as well as marketplace trends.

Note: This position is a part of our Strategic Partner Content Operations team , reports to our Sr. Manager, Content Operations, and is based out of Shutterstock’s New York headquarters in the Empire State Building. This role is for Summer 2020, running June through August. 

Responsibilities
  Assist in managing content strategic partnership accounts   Ensure content partner happiness & loyalty; making their success a primary focus ensuring that every interaction with Shutterstock is a rewarding experience   Provide strategic content partner administrative support, including account set-up and onboarding and day-to-day partner operations   Assist as needed with content submission feedback for strategic partners; provide insights and guidance on standards, compliance policies and the optimal use of content upload processes   Conduct quality evaluation of media assets and related metadata ensuring marketplace integrity and consistency for published content   Participate in the creation and presentation of reviewer policy and standards webinars   Participate in auditing of collection for compliance with new or updated policy and standards  

Requirements
  Rising senior (or recent grad), pursuing a bachelor’s degree   Hands-On Mentality: You should love rolling up your sleeves and working alongside the team.   Understanding and enthusiasm for Photography, Illustration and/or Footage experience   Enjoy helping people, solving problems, and working to provide a better user experience   Engaging personality with exceptional leadership, communication and networking skills   Technically minded; ability to provide creative ideas around using technology to improve the contributor experience  

Preferred Qualifications
  Software experience using media production and editing tools, including: Adobe Creative Suite, Final Cut Pro, Compressor, After Effects, Excel, Google Docs and file sharing protocol.  

About Shutterstock

Shutterstock, Inc. (NYSE: SSTK ), directly and through its group subsidiaries, is a leading global provider of high-quality licensed photographs , vectors , illustrations , videos and music to businesses, marketing agencies and media organizations around the world. Working with its growing community of contributors, Shutterstock adds hundreds of thousands of images each week and has millions of images and video clips available.

Headquartered in New York City, Shutterstock has offices around the world and customers in more than 150 countries. The company also owns Bigstock , a value-oriented stock media agency; Shutterstock Custom, a custom content creation platform , Offset, a high-end image collection ; PremiumBeat a curated royalty-free music library; Rex Features, a premier source of editorial images for the world's media.

For more information, please visit www.shutterstock.com and follow Shutterstock on Twitter , Facebook and Instagram .

Job Description

At Solar Turbines, we are dedicated to attracting and retaining next generation talent. Our new graduates work on projects that impact our business and the future of our company. With offices and facilities around the world, our recruits will collaborate and connect with Solar employees on a global scale.

You will be welcomed into a workforce that powers the future with innovative ideas that you make a reality. Join our team of experts in engineering, manufacturing and operations, sales, supply chain, environmental health and safety, human resources and more!

The Engineer Rotation Programs provides the foundation for the future success of Solar Turbines engineers and the future success of the organization. The purpose of the program is to start the development and training of the next generation of highly capable and highly competent engineers.

This is a 3-year rotational program for recently graduated engineers. The candidate will spend an extensive period in training that will focus on a broad exposure to our products and the Customer Service organization.

The training you receive will be a combination of classroom and on-line training, significant hands-on experience, structured on the job training in the field and mentored controls system training at various Solar locations including Senawang (MY), San Diego (CA), Mabank (TX) and Desoto (TX). Each phase of the program emphasises a different aspect of field operations.

Topics covered include
 Safety training  Gas turbine package familiarization training  Controls system training  Customer services experience  Engine Overhaul/Repair  Power Generation and Gas compression  Trouble shooting  Structured on the job (Hands on) training at Customer Sites in the Field 
This program offers an excellent opportunity to combine formal training with hands on experience in the field at our district office in Kuala Lumpur, MY as a Field Service Representative.

This position requires significant travel and interface in customer facilities. Frequent communication with the customer and technical personnel is required while diagnosing turbine package and balance of plant related issues. In addition, the successful candidate will be required to work safely and with little supervision in the field environment while maintaining a high degree of responsibility and professionalism.

Minimum Qualifications
 2:1 equivalent Bachelor's degree in Mechanical, Electrical, Aerospace, or Related Engineering  Must have graduated within the last 3 calendar years  Must be able and willing to travel, relocate, and work overtime. 

Preferred Qualifications
 Able to work in extreme or adverse environments.  High integrity and a high level of self-confidence.  Ability to handle stress and communicate in a professional manner.  Previous internship/placement or related work experience is beneficial  Depending on the amount of applications, preferred qualifications might move to be required.

fields.post_html_body:
About Us

 WORKER  BASE is a start-up in the field of industrial software and hardware development. Our Fortune 500 customers use our solution to optimize manual work processes. They achieve amazing results and accelerate their processes by up to 81%. No programming knowledge is required to redesign processes with  WORKER  BASE. With our AppBuilder, customers can create new applications for our Smartwatch and other mobile devices in hours or minutes. Our product allows to redesign and digitally coordinate work processes from scratch. We become a universal interface between people and different IT systems. We are financed by some of the most renowned venture capital investors and our management team looks back on many years of experience in product development for the industry. In the development of the company it is very important to us to create a company with an international orientation that offers many opportunities for personal growth. This starts with the composition of our internationally mixed team.

 TECHNOLOGIES WE USE 
 TypeScript and React are central to our front-end development.  JavaScript and Node.js for the back-end development.  Docker and Kubernetes for microservices.  MQTT and RabbitMQ for real time messages distribution between backend and devices in the shopfloor (smartwatches, smartphones, tablets, smart glasses).  Industry-standard build tooling, including Webpack, ESLint and GitLab. 
If you want to see our full stack, take a look at our StackShare page (

What We Value
2 years (or above) experience in back-end or front-end development.  You are a strong back-end coder. Regardless of which frameworks you use or how you learned them, we're looking for people who can write clean, effective code.  Strong engineering background, preferably in fields such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Software Engineering, Physics.  Understanding of how web technologies work.  You are passionate about building user interfaces that enable users to solve their problems.  High intellectual curiosity about technology, whether it is the latest SpaceX Starship or Crypto, we love curious people. 
 YOUR MISSION 
 The work will focus mostly on greenfield development and improvement of our existing products.  Think, design and implement highly performing technical solutions.  Design and implement complex codes for enhancing our products.  Projects will include building APIs and developing microservices to evolve our existing architecture.  We have a minimalist approach to using external frameworks, with emphasis on maintainability and fast turnaround with TDD, DDD and Continuous Integration & Delivery. 

What We Offer

Our product is unique, as is our team. We have flat hierarchies and communicate openly with each other. We offer you exciting projects with personal responsibility from day one.
 Short decision paths and a creative as well as agile environment.  Flexible working hours.  MacBook Pro and all the latest tech you need.  Top modern facilities and an office close to the city center.  Regular team events, Oktoberfest visit, Christmas party.  And many more benefits. 
 HIRING PROCESS 
 Applicant initial validation: added value, key achievements, motivation, fit quality.  Video interview.  Coding challenge.  On-site interviews and getting to know the team members. 
DO YOU WANT TO JOIN OUR RIDE? WE'LL BE MORE THAN HAPPY TO MEET YOU!

fields.post_html_body:
Company Description

As the world's leader in digital payments technology, Visa's mission is to connect the world through the most creative, reliable and secure payment network - enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive. Our advanced global processing network, VisaNet, provides secure and reliable payments around the world, and is capable of handling more than 65,000 transaction messages a second. The company's dedication to innovation drives the rapid growth of connected commerce on any device, and fuels the dream of a cashless future for everyone, everywhere. As the world moves from analog to digital, Visa is applying our brand, products, people, network and scale to reshape the future of commerce.

At Visa, your individuality fits right in. Working here gives you an opportunity to impact the world, invest in your career growth, and be part of an inclusive and diverse workplace. We are a global team of disruptors, trailblazers, innovators and risk-takers who are helping drive economic growth in even the most remote parts of the world, creatively moving the industry forward, and doing meaningful work that brings financial literacy and digital commerce to millions of unbanked and underserved consumers.

You're an Individual. We're the team for you. Together, let's transform the way the world pays.

Job Description And Responsibilities

As a New Grad, Software Test Engineer (Master Degree), you will work side by side with a highly energetic and seasoned group of developers and business partners in an Agile environment. In this role, you will play an important part in software development stories from their inception to coding and testing ensuring the highest quality of software and architecture.

Some things you might work on as a New Grad, Software Test Engineer (Master Degree) are:
Design and implement manual and automated test cases utilizing Fitnesse, Selenium, C#Support overall testing lifecycle (upstream and downstream) as part of the testing team assigned to development and integration projectsProvide testing framework to ensure individual projects are in compliance with standards and practicesProvide insight, IIT requirements into testing standards development and evolutionEnsures overall quality standards are incorporated into test plans

Qualifications

So what are we looking for in a New Grad, Software Test Engineer (Master Degree)?

At Collins Aerospace, we’re dedicated to relentlessly tackling the toughest challenges in our industry – all to redefine aerospace.

Created in 2018 through the combination of two leading companies – Rockwell Collins and United Technologies Aerospace Systems – we’re driving the industry forward through technologically advanced and intelligent solutions for global aerospace and defense. Every day we imagine ways to make the skies and the spaces we touch smarter, safer and more amazing than ever. Together we chart new journeys, reunite families, protect nations and save lives. And we do it all with some of the greatest talent this industry has to offer.

We are Collins Aerospace and we hope you join us as we REDEFINE AEROSPACE.

Do you want to be a part of something bigger? A team whose impact stretches across the world, and even beyond? At Collins Aerospace, our Mission Systems team helps civilian, military and government customers complete their most complex missions — whatever and wherever they may be. Our customers depend on us for intelligent and secure communications, missionized systems for specialized aircraft and spacecraft and collaborative space solutions. By joining our team, you’ll have your own critical part to play in ensuring our customer succeeds today while anticipating their needs for tomorrow. Are you up for the challenge? Join our mission today. We are currently searching for a Software Engineer - New Grad - Air Combat Training to join our team in Cedar Rapids, IA. A relocation package is available for qualified candidates.

Job Summary

"I feel the need...the need for speed!" If you like the movie "Top Gun", you will love the Test and Training Instrumentation Engineering Department.
This Software Engineer will work in the Mission Systems Test and Training Instrumentation Engineering Department developing and testing embedded and application level software. The TTI Department develops state-of-the-art Test and Training Products for cryptographic datalink networking and command and control applications. We specialize in the development of high quality highly secure solutions for U.S. military communication systems navigation systems and networks. We mature products from concept phase through accreditation and factory production.

Job Responsibilities

This position may include support of software requirements definition and design implementing software in C/C++/Java testing software and software-hardware integration. The ideal candidate will have at least a 3.5 cumulative GPA and excellent communications skills to communicate technical issues and status in both written and oral form. Candidates must be motivated to learn new technologies be a strong team player and contribute to a positive work environment.

 Bachelor's degree in a Science, Technology, Engineering or Math (STEM) discipline  U.S. Citizenship is required and must possess or meet eligibility requirement for obtaining a U.S. DoD Secret Clearance Good written and verbal communications skills and the ability to work well with others in a professional team environmentGood organizational skills and the ability to manage individual tasks while balancing priorities and schedulesMotivated self-starter with good analytical skills

At Collins Aerospace, we believe a solid work-life balance creates a healthy lifestyle and inspires creativity and innovation. We value our people and invest in their development, growth and success at our company by providing development opportunities through Collins Aerospace University, networking, mentoring, and tuition reimbursement.

And that’s just for starters.

 Medical, dental, and vision insurance  Three weeks of vacation for newly hired employees  Company-paid winter holiday shutdown for most locations  Generous 401(k) plan that matches 62.5 percent of the first 8 percent of eligible compensation you contribute (or 5 percent if you save 8 percent)  An Incentive Pay Plan based upon company performance  Tuition reimbursement  And more
