AI Engineer, Intern
Location: London- United Kingdom
Job ID: 19WD33889

Position Overview

You can help develop the technology of the future, that enables creative people to focus on what they want to make, leaving the detailed design to Machine Intelligence? This is a great opportunity to join the Autodesk Research AI Lab as a research intern and help to create the tools and algorithms that augments the brain power of the engineers and designers of the future. You can find out more about some of Autodesk Research previous projects such Dreamcatcher, Discover, and BrickBot online. We are looking for a talented post-graduate student to join our team for a few months to work on an exciting and innovative project using AI/ML/DL aiming to bring style and aesthetics to Generative Design. We are now recruiting interns with the talent and ambition to become research engineers. As part of one of the fastest-growing companies in the CAD/CAM industry, you will work alongside other research scientists, engineers and R&D developers in an environment that is both challenging and rewarding. As your skills develop, you will be expected to work using your own initiative to develop innovative solutions to meet our customers’ demands for software that is faster, better, and smarter.

Responsibilities
Implement AI agents and Machine Learning prototypes Collaborate with researchers and developers in the team Participate in brainstorming sessions and come up with innovative ideas Read papers and perform literature reviews Evaluate existing algorithms and reproduce results on specific datasets 

Minimum Requirements
A relevant degree in a STEM field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent practical experience Background and experience in one of the following: Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Data Science Excellent Programming and software development skills and experience with Python Experience with one of the DL platforms (TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, etc.)Excellent math skills (Completed coursework in: Linear Algebra, Probability, Statistics, Calculus, or equivalent) Excellent communication skills 

Preferred Requirements
 Professional work experience in software development  Experience with 3D graphics / 3D geometry manipulation / Computational Geometry  Ex perience with Deep style transfer, Geometric Deep Learning, or Reinforcement Learning  Experience with other Machine Learning libraries and packages such as TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, scikit-learn  Experience with HPC and Cloud computing  Experience with Git, Docker, C++, CUDA, Latex, Matlab 

About Autodesk

With Autodesk software, you have the power to Make Anything. The future of making is here, bringing with it radical changes in the way things are designed, made, and used. It’s disrupting every industry: architecture, engineering, and construction; manufacturing; and media and entertainment. With the right knowledge and tools, this disruption is your opportunity. Our software is used by everyone - from design professionals, engineers and architects to digital artists, students and hobbyists. We constantly explore new ways to integrate all dimensions of diversity across our employees, customers, partners, and communities. Our ultimate goal is to expand opportunities for anyone to imagine, design, and make a better world.

Europe, Middle East and Africa-United Kingdom (UK)-England-London

Intern and New Grad

About The Company

Robinhood is democratizing our financial system. With customers at the heart of our decisions, Robinhood is lowering barriers, removing fees, and providing greater access to financial information. Together, we are building products and services that help create a financial system everyone can participate in.

Robinhood is a fast-growing company and was recognized as a CNBC Disruptor 50 and a LinkedIn Top Startup in 2019. We’re continuing to grow and are looking for incredible talent that can help us achieve our mission.

Robinhood is headquartered in Menlo Park, California, with offices in Lake Mary, Florida, and London, UK.

About The Role

We’re hiring a Recruiting Manager to scale University Programs to support the needs of the Engineering and Business functions at Robinhood. You’ll use your experience to mentor, grow, and manage a team of recruiters, program managers, and coordinators. You will partner closely with key leaders across our engineering and business teams to build comprehensive strategies to engage the best talent at each school.

Your Day-to-day Will Involve
 Evaluate and scale our university programs which includes, but not limited to: internships, Co-ops, new grad hiring and other campus programs Partner with our Engineering, Product and Business teams to develop a comprehensive strategy to engage the appropriate schools and programs that deliver world class talent to Robinhood Mentor a growing team of recruiters, program managers and coordinators Implement a team structure that best leverages our resources to create successful outcomes (example - campus specialist vs. full cycle recruiters) 

Some Things We Consider Critical For This Role
 Bachelor's degree, or equivalent experience, with 5+ years of university recruiting experience At least 2+ years of people management experience Proven track record of building and managing a growing university program/recruiting team, preferably in a hyper-growth start-up environment You use data to inform decisions and influence changes across the program Experience with successful diversity programs is highly preferred Experience partnering and influencing Executives and Hiring Managers throughout the recruiting cycle. Ability to thrive in fast paced environments You can think on your feet but have enough humility to ask questions 

Bonus Points
 Passion for working and learning in a fast-growing company 
Feeling ready to give 100% to democratizing our financial system? We’d love to have you apply, even if you feel unsure about whether you meet every single requirement in this posting. At Robinhood, we’re looking for people invigorated by our mission, not just those who simply check off all the boxes.

New Grad – Digital Sales Centre – Digital Sales Associate 

(VMware Academy 2020). 

Location: Barcelona, Spain

Start date: 20th July 2020

VMware, as industry leaders in virtualization and software-defined solutions and services, enables our customers to modernize their data centers, integrate public clouds, empower the digital workspace, and transform security. Our sales team is responsible for driving new business; ensuring clarity in messaging; increasing audience engagement; supporting and promoting corporate strategy and initiatives; and developing, improving, and executing area business plans.

Academy Overview

VMware invests for the future in our global sales organization through new hire graduate programs. The VMware Academy (VA) is an extensive new career program with three tracks: Inside Sales, Technical Services and Professional Services.

The academy involves sales, technical and product training for all participants. Beginning with a foundational approach that progresses from classroom to practice and then on the job enablement, successful participants move into a Digital Sales Role: the next step in their VMware Journey.

We're looking for people who love achieving through confidence, self-discipline, and determination. Do you live your ethics and values? Are you a positive and stimulating influence on others? Are you investing in your future now?

Role Description

Continuing to deliver the next generation of sales professionals from VMware’s Digital Sales Centre in Barcelona, Spain, our focus is building a team of graduate level Digital Sales professionals to fill future roles and support future expansion of a number of Digital Sales functions, including Internal Sales Associates and Sales Specialists with a long-term view to progress to a field sales role back in your home country.

Graduate Program Overview

If you are selected for the graduate team, you will undergo training to include participation in a variety of customer and partner facing sales activities/tasks. Development is very hands-on and practical with an emphasis on experiential learning by doing. Topics to be trained include: Fundamental Sales Skills, Distance Selling, Commercial Presentation skills, Account Management and VMware Technologies.

Typical Responsibilities For The Sales Role Are Detailed Below

After successfully completing the training period, graduates who perform competently will progress into a primary customer facing sales role as available or alternatively may support their Digital Sales team within the Sales Associate role until a future territory is made available.

The responsibilities include all duties from prospecting to closing accounts with the channel sales team and Territory Executives for the territories they support. This position requires independent and purposeful action, initiative, a sense of urgency, and the ability to make timely and responsible decisions.
Be a valued member and contributor to the EMEA Sales and Field Marketing teamsDevelop and maintain proficient knowledge of products and services, industry trends, and competitionResearch accounts, identify key players, generate interest and obtain business requirements while maintaining accurate account and contact information.Drive and continuously improve customer and channel partner experience with greater opportunity engagement and longer-term relationship buildEffectively promote VMware’s value driven suite of solutions to prospects, customers, and partner’s audiences through discovery, positioning, and objection handling.Engage timely in collaborative channel sales activities while also driving new and incremental solution adoption amongst your existing VMware customer base.Create, qualify, update, and accurately forecast opportunities within Salesforce.com through our reliable global sales methodologyComplete general territory admin duties to include special pricing forms, re-assignment management, customer/partner issues as appropriate

Graduate Team Requirements
Bachelor’s and/or Master’s degreeFluency in English and DutchCandidates need to have graduated within 12 months from the start date (July 2020)Persistence and initiative with a track record of success in academic achievement to dateDynamic individual, keen to work and collaborate in a high-energy team dependent environment.Positive and engaging phone manner, excellent listening and interpersonal skills, strong writing skills.Inquisitive commercial interests, manner, and aptitude.Ability to manage several tasks at once and succeed in a rapidly changing environmentProficient with standard corporate productivity tools (email, voicemail, MS Office)A basic understanding of computing technology, a dedication to ongoing learning, and comfort discussing technology and business value with customersA career objective to progress to a field sales role in our field sales territories
Before you join, VMware will require you to go through a pre-employment screening process. This means that we will want to verify your details and the information you have given us to ensure your suitability for a certain role.

Ciena may well be the most important technology company you’ve never heard of. The innovations that wow us (driverless cars), and those we now take for granted (the ability to mobile-stream your favorite show) are the products of ingenuity from some brilliant and forward-thinking companies. But those companies rely on Ciena, another vanguard of innovation, to create and advance the underlying networks that bring their breakthroughs to our doorsteps. VR, AI, IOT, 5G … literally none of it would be possible without the mind-boggling technology that makes the internet itself work. For more than 25 years, Ciena has been the global leader in networking strategy, and our technology has been part of the critical infrastructure running within the most advanced companies in the world.
What will you do at Ciena?

The test engineering team is looking for a dynamic candidate (new grad) to join the group responsible for developing tests on Packet Optical products as well as sustaining current production.

Test engineer duties and responsibilities
 Analysis of circuit schematics for manufacturing test requirements. Design & develop test plan strategy Develop & Automate test sequences using Ciena’s tool Validation Test cases on Prototypes in lab environment Debug electrical circuits, Test Documentation & debug procedures. Station design Production support
Collaboration with stakeholders
 Teamwork with test engineering colleagues and overall operations engineering Strong collaboration with the R&D team Teamwork with our Ciena remote support team at our Contract manufacturers. Interactions with Supply Management, Project managers, Product engineers

 Time to market on new products Cost of manufacturing & tests (Max coverage at best cost) – profit margin impact Product performance as per our specification, Quality & Reliability
Experience & Skills
 Bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering. Software coding skills. (Python, C# a must) Cad tool (Altium skills) Electronics excellent knowledge. Great communications skills and bilingual (French, English) Critical thinker and problem-solving skills
Rewarding experience. Meaningful outcomes.

Making a difference in people's lives through design and implementation of leading network technologies. That's what motivates us.

A distinct way to work

Free thinking, free discussion, and collaboration are the norm. Expect more satisfying outcomes - both personal and professional.

Ciena values the diversity of our workforce and respects its employees as individuals, regardless of race, nationality, religion, sexual orientation, gender or age.

Ciena is also committed to developing inclusive, barrier-free selection processes and work environments. Information received relating to any specific needs / accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially.

What you can expect from us
 You will receive notification of your successful application Successful applicants will be contacted by Talent Acquisition for an initial discussion If suitable you will be considered for the short list and our formal interview process

At Collins Aerospace, we’re dedicated to relentlessly tackle the toughest challenges in our industry – all to redefine aerospace.

Created in 2018 through the combination of two leading companies– Rockwell Collins and United Technologies Aerospace Systems – we’re driving the industry forward through technologically advanced and intelligent solutions for global aerospace and defense. Every day we imagine ways to make the skies and the spaces we touch smarter, safer and more amazing than ever. Together we chart new journeys, reunite families, protect nations and save lives. And we do it all with some of the greatest talent this industry has to offer.

We are Collins Aerospace and we hope you join us as we REDEFINE AEROSPACE.

Our Avionics team advances aviation electronics and information management solutions for commercial and military customers across the world. That means we’re helping passengers reach their destination safely. We’re connecting aircraft operators, airports, rail and critical infrastructure with intelligent data service solutions that keep passengers, flight crews and militaries connected and informed. And we’re providing industry-leading fire protection and safety systems that our customers can count on when it matters most. Are you ready to learn from the most knowledgeable experts in the industry, develop the technologies of tomorrow and reach new heights in your career? Join our Avionics team today.Collins Aerospace makes modern flight possible. Of course, that wouldn’t be possible without the capabilities and technologies of our organization, as well as our engineers – a highly skilled, accomplished network that spans more than 180 sites, 24 countries and 6 Strategic Business Units (SBUs).
Our industry-leading experts are setting the standards for the aerospace industry and paving the way for the future. But as new challenges present themselves, we need fresh, creative and motivated minds to overcome these hurdles, help us break barriers and achieve new levels of innovation. Do you have what it takes to join a global, diverse organization that doesn’t shy away from big opportunities? If so, we invite you to join our ranks and create the next generation of aerospace technologies.
Together, we will nurture an engineering culture that values intellectual curiosity, risk takers and integrity. A place where we will challenge ourselves, our teams, and the status quo and where we will work to find a way – the right way – to achieve what others can only dream of.

Role Overview
This position is for a entry-level Software Engineering professional responsible for software engineering processes and activities. Consolidates test results and conducts single disciplinary research, applying hardware and software standards.

Primary Responsibilities
 Conducts engineering processes and standard work, including verification and qualification procedures. Compiles and consolidates testing on diagnostic systems containing logical and mathematical solutions. Assists in conducting disciplinary research on one or more stages of the equipment design phase to develop design options and recommendations. Learns hardware and software standards and ensures work product adheres to these standards and business objectives of the organization are met. Designs, develops, documents, tests and debugs control and diagnostic systems that contain logical and mathematical solutions. Conducts multidisciplinary research and collaborates with equipment designers in the planning, design, development, and utilization of electronic data processing systems for product and commercial software. Determines end user needs by analyzing system capabilities to resolve problems on program intent, output requirements and input data acquisition. Ensures hardware and software standards are met. Designs and implements build procedures that are used to support hardware and software product development and use. May develop software configuration standards for company-wide use. May train software developers in the use of configuration management tools and the implementation of software quality standards. Includes control modeling (model based design).
Qualifications

Preferred Qualifications:

Basic Qualifications

This position requires a Bachelor’s degree in the appropriate discipline and less than 3 years of relevant experience. In the absence of a degree, 4 years of relevant experience is required.

Job Description

Become a member of one of the largest engineering companies in the world!

You'll be part of the team developing the next generation of FPGA design tools for Intel's Programmable Solutions Group. We are looking for an energetic, top-notch electrical engineer who will be directly responsible for building key components for a platform that enables unparalleled productivity and capabilities for our customers.

The ideal candidate is inclined towards hardware development and experienced in HDL such as System Verilog or VHDL. Have demonstrated the ability to research and develop efficient automation systems or solutions. The candidate must also have demonstrated capability in diving into new and unfamiliar areas in the ASIC design to customer product cycle.

Responsibilities
 Develop and maintain software used for configuring digital sub-systems on an FPGA.  Develop and maintain tools and flows used to translate design collateral into models for customer interfaces.  Partner with cross-functional teams to ensure smooth product delivery. 

Behavioral Traits
 Verbal and written communication skills. 

Qualifications

You must possess minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Experience listed below would be obtained through a combination of your school work/classes/research and/or relevant previous job and/or internship experiences. This is an entry level position and will be compensated accordingly.

Minimum Requirements

The candidate must have a Master's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering or related field.

Minimum Of 6 Months Experience In
 Software development with a high level language like C, C++ and/or Java.  Scripting languages (Python and/or Perl).  Hardware Description Languages (Verilog and/or VHDL). 

Preferred Qualifications
 Familiarity with version control systems like Perforce, CVS, or Git in a Unix/Linux environment.  Familiarity with FPGA architecture and tools.  Digital simulators (VCS).  Circuit design or RTL design.  Inside this Business Group

The Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) was formed from the acquisition of Altera. As part of Intel, PSG will create market-leading programmable logic devices that deliver a wider range of capabilities than customers experience today. Combining Altera's industry-leading FPGA technology and customer support with Intel's world-class semiconductor manufacturing capabilities will enable customers to create the next generation of electronic systems with unmatched performance and power efficiency. PSG takes pride in creating an energetic and dynamic work environment that is driven by ingenuity and innovation. We believe the growth and success of our group is directly linked to the growth and satisfaction of our employees. That is why PSG is committed to a work environment that is flexible and collaborative, and allows our employees to reach their full potential.

fields.company_name: New Grad – Digital Sales Centre – Digital Sales Associate with German
fields.post_html_body:
New Grad – Digital Sales Centre – Digital Sales Associate with German

(VMware Academy 2020). 

Location: Barcelona, Spain

Start date: 20th July 2020

Function Overview

VMware, as industry leader in virtualization and software-defined solutions and services, enables our customers to modernize their data centers, integrate public clouds, empower the digital workspace, and transform security. Our sales team is responsible for driving new business; ensuring clarity in messaging; increasing audience engagement; supporting and promoting corporate strategy and initiatives; and developing, improving, and executing area business plans.

Academy Overview

VMware invests for the future in our global sales organization through new hire graduate programs. The VMware Academy (VA) is an extensive new career program with three tracks: Inside Sales, Technical Services and Professional Services.

The academy involves sales, technical and product training for all participants. Beginning with a foundational approach that progresses from classroom to practice and then on the job enablement, successful participants move into a Digital Sales Role: the next step in their VMware Journey.

We're looking for people who love achieving through confidence, self-discipline, and determination. Do you live your ethics and values? Are you a positive and stimulating influence on others? Are you investing in your future now?

Role Description

Continuing to deliver the next generation of sales professional from VMware’s Digital Sales Centre in Barcelona, Spain, our focus is building a team of graduate level Digital Sales professionals to fill future roles and support future expansion of a number of Digital Sales functions, including Internal Sales Associates and Sales Specialists with a long-term view to progress to a field sales role back in your home country.

Graduate Program Overview

If you are selected for the graduate team, you will undergo training to include participation in a variety of customer and partner facing sales activities/tasks. Development is very hands-on and practical with an emphasis on experiential learning by doing. Topics to be trained include: Fundamental Sales Skills, Distance Selling, Commercial Presentation skills, Account Management and VMware Technologies

Typical Responsibilities For The Sales Role Are Detailed Below

After successfully completing the training period, graduates who perform competently will progress into a primary customer facing sales role as available or alternatively may support their Digital Sales team within the Sales Associate role until a future territory is made available.

The responsibilities include all duties from prospecting to closing accounts with the channel sales team and Territory Executives for the territories they support. This position requires independent and purposeful action, initiative, a sense of urgency, and the ability to make timely and responsible decisions.
Be a valued member and contributor to the EMEA Sales and Field Marketing teamsDevelop and maintain proficient knowledge of products and services, industry trends, and competitionResearch accounts, identify key players, generate interest and obtain business requirements while maintaining accurate account and contact information.Drive and continuously improve customer and channel partner experience with greater opportunity engagement and longer-term relationship buildEffectively promote VMware’s value driven suite of solutions to prospects, customers, and partners audiences through discovery, positioning, and objection handling.Engage timely in collaborative channel sales activities while also driving new and incremental solution adoption amongst your existing VMware customer base.Create, qualify, update, and accurately forecast opportunities within Salesforce.com through our reliable global sales methodologyComplete general territory admin duties to include special pricing forms, re-assignment management, customer/partner issues as appropriate

Graduate Team Requirements
Bachelor’s and/or Master’s degreeFluency in English & GermanCandidates need to have graduated within 12 months from the start date (July 2020)Persistence and initiative with a track record of success in academic achievement to dateDynamic individual, keen to work and collaborate in a high-energy team dependent environment.Positive and engaging phone manner, excellent listening and interpersonal skills, strong writing skills.Inquisitive commercial interests, manner, and aptitude.Ability to manage several tasks at once and succeed in a rapidly changing environmentProficient with standard corporate productivity tools (email, voicemail, MS Office)A basic understanding of computing technology, a dedication to ongoing learning, and comfort discussing technology and business value with customersA career objective to progress to a field sales role in our field sales territories

Before you join, VMware will require you to go through a pre-employment screening process. This means that we will want to verify your details and the information you have given us to ensure your suitability for a certain role.

Category : Sales
Subcategory: Inside Sales
Experience: New Graduate
Full Time/ Part Time: Full Time
Work From Home: No

We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Shape what’s possible today at http://careers.vmware.com.

fields.post_html_body:
Job Description

At Solar Turbines, we are dedicated to attracting and retaining next generation talent. Our new graduates work on projects that impact our business and the future of our company. With offices and facilities around the world, our recruits will collaborate and connect with Solar employees on a global scale.

You will be welcomed into a workforce that powers the future with innovative ideas that you make a reality. Join our team of experts in engineering, manufacturing and operations, sales, supply chain, environmental health and safety, human resources and more!

The Engineer Rotation Programs provides the foundation for the future success of Solar Turbines engineers and the future success of the organization. The purpose of the program is to start the development and training of the next generation of highly capable and highly competent engineers.

This is a 3-year rotational program for recently graduated engineers. The candidate will spend an extensive period in training that will focus on a broad exposure to our products and the Customer Service organization. The training you receive will be a combination of classroom and on-line training, significant hands-on experience, structured on the job training in the field and
mentored controls system training at various Solar locations including Senawang (MY), San Diego (CA), Mabank (TX) and Desoto (TX). Each phase of the program emphasises a different aspect of field operations.

Topics covered include
 Safety training Gas turbine package familiarization training Controls system training Customer services experience Engine Overhaul/Repair Power Generation and Gas compression Trouble shooting Structured on the job (Hands on) training at Customer Sites in the Field
This program offers an excellent opportunity to combine formal training with hands on experience in the field at our district office in Kuala Lumpur, MY as a Field Service Representative.This position requires significant travel and interface in customer facilities. Frequent communication with the customer and technical personnel is required while diagnosing turbine package and balance of plant related issues. In addition, the successful candidate will be required to work safely and with little supervision in the
field environment while maintaining a high degree of responsibility and professionalism.

Minimum Qualifications
 2:1 equivalent Bachelor's degree in Mechanical, Electrical, Aerospace, or Related Engineering Must have graduated within the last 3 calendar years Must be able and willing to travel, relocate, and work overtime.
Preferred Qualifications
 Able to work in extreme or adverse environments. High integrity and a high level of self-confidence. Ability to handle stress and communicate in a professional manner. Previous internship/placement or related work experience is beneficial

At Peak, we are reaching hundreds of millions of users with our products. Marketing Team is at the core of developing and implementing marketing strategies in order to create impact and reach even more users.  
 We’re looking for fresh graduates to join our rapidly growing Marketing team. Managing and optimizing marketing campaigns of our products on all performance channels, you will improve  your analytical skills, develop understanding of business drivers and advance manipulating data to obtain high-quality actionable insights. You will experience teaming up with Marketing Artists to come up with new creative ideas and learn combining a data-driven approach with creative skills.

fields.company_name: New Grad Full-Time Rotational Experienced Designer
fields.post_html_body:
Description

Position at Zynga

About Us

Zynga is a leading developer of the world’s most popular social games that are played by millions of people around the world each day. We are headquartered in San Francisco and have additional offices in the U.S, Canada, U.K, Finland, Turkey, and India. Since our founding in 2007, our mission has been to connect the world through games and delight consumers with social gaming experiences. To-date, more than one billion people have played our games across Web and mobile, including FarmVille, Zynga Poker, Words With Friends, Hit it Rich! Slots, CSR Racing, Merge Dragons, and Empires and Puzzles!

OUR TEAM

Making a game requires passion, innovation, and creativity. Zynga wants to take exceptional new graduates and turn them into world-class designers who will be responsible for creating the games of tomorrow. Our team will immerse you in a 12 month program composed of two rotations. You work across disciplines alongside our best and brightest to design experiences that engage and delight our players.

About Our Program

During the program you will develop and execute the UX vision of a product, build innovative, user-centered design solutions that promote ease of use and provide outstanding player experiences that are optimized for mobile devices.

You will participate in all phases of the design process including conceptual design, prototypes, user/task flows, art production, and game integration. Work with project partners to execute and maintain the visual integrity, interaction methods, brand standards, and consistency throughout the game. Collaborate with designers, product managers, artists, producers, and engineers on the execution of designs.
Pair you with senior mentors during your time in the design programProvide full access to training/workshops by our talented directors of design

What We Are Looking For
Collaborate with the UX team on crafting UI wireframes, mockups, and prototypesBuild and implement high quality UI visual design.Rapidly iterate on designs that are aligned with the game art directionIntegrate feedback on in-development layouts and visualsProactively seek out solutions to complex visual language problems Fix UX issues and resolve friction points in the game flowDegree in graphic arts, interaction design, or equivalentDetailed understanding of usability, UX, UI, interaction design, and motion design.Experience with Unity or other game engines is a plus.Proficient with Adobe Creative SuiteWorking knowledge of common UX software such as Sketch, Adobe XD, etc.Passion for problem solving and finding creative solutions for efficiency and consistency.Actively seeks to learn. Generates new ideas and solutions.Strong interpersonal skills and are able to articulate, present, and speak clearly about design decisions.Ability to work with team members across multiple studio locations.Passion for gaming in general, not just within the mobile space.A link to your online portfolio, or a PDF, is required. Applications without a portfolio will not be considered.

fields.company_name: Analyst - Transfer Pricing - New grad Winter 2020
fields.post_html_body:
Be empowered to lead and have impact with clients, our communities and in the office.   Enjoy flexible, proactive, and practical benefits that foster a culture of well-being and connectedness.   Experience an agile work environment where work is what you do not where you do it  
Are you up for the challenge of leading at every level, developing a global network of colleagues, and embracing endless opportunity? Join the Tax Practice at Deloitte.

 What will your typical day look like? 

Your role as a Transfer Pricing Analyst at Deloitte:
  Participating in client meetings and interviews   Analyzing and helping clients develop intercompany policies for goods and services transactions multi-nationally   Performing risk analysis of companies by reviewing their operations and identifying potential transfer pricing issues   Conducting research and market analysis to assist clients on transfer pricing matters.   Engrain yourself in a culture that fosters excellence   Interact and develop global and cross-service line relationships at every level – build a network that lasts a lifetime .  
With this said, no two days are the same. Our clients evolve and so do we.

About The Team

Deloitte’s globally-managed transfer pricing team helps companies reduce risks by aligning practical transfer pricing solutions with overall global business operations and objectives, assists with strategic documentation to support transfer pricing practices, and resolves disputes efficiently. The tax services at Deloitte are a driving force in the growth of the firm in Canada and globally. Deloitte has been recognized globally as the top firm for tax and transfer pricing services. The Transfer Pricing service line is a rapidly expanding area of the Canadian firm. We provide a dynamic work environment that fosters creativity and communication.

Enough About Us, Let’s Talk About You

You are someone who:
  Is working towards the completion of an undergraduate degree in Economics, Commerce, Business, Finance, Accounting, Law, Mathematics or Statistics.   Is a leader and takes initiative, in and out of the work environment by having strong interpersonal and team-building skills   Has superior analytical and problem-solving skills   Strong writing skills Excellent interpersonal relations and demonstrated ability to work with others effectively in teams; and an ability to thrive in an environment of pressing deadlines and constantly changing conditions  
Has experience with MS office suite (significant experience with Excel is an asset

 Why Deloitte? 

Launch your career with The One Firm where you can make an impact that matters in a way that you never thought possible. With endless opportunities at every turn, and a culture built to support and develop our people to be the very best they can be, Deloitte is  The One Firm  for you to learn, grow, create, connect, and lead. We do this by making three commitments to you:
   You will lead at every level:  We grow the world’s best leaders so you can achieve the impact you seek, faster.    You can work your way:  We give you the means to be flexible in how you need and want to work, and we have innovative spaces, arrangements and the mindset to help you be wildly successful.    You will feel included and inspired:  We create a deep sense of belonging where you can bring your whole self to work.  
 The next step is yours 

Sound like  The One Firm. For You ? Apply by January 19th, 2020. 

Please submit your CV, transcript and Cover letter in one PDF document.

At Deloitte we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities! We encourage you to connect with us at accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca if you require an accommodation in the recruitment process, or need this job posting in an alternative format. We’d love to hear from you!

By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.

OptumCare will educate and prepare Physicians for next generation population health models in a top-notch patient and provider setting. The customized program will be completed at OptumCare facilities with a deep exposure to primary care within a team-based practice environment. Positions in this function will hold an advanced degree (MD/DO) and are generally in their third year of an internal medicine or family medicine residency program.

You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.

MD/DO degreeMust be in an accredited residency program 

Careers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make the health system work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.SM

fields.company_name: Grad Intern - Human Resources Development Program (Summer 2020)
fields.post_html_body:
Amgen is the world’s leading biotechnology company. Nurtured on a foundation of strong values, Amgen is deeply rooted in science and innovation to transform new ideas and discoveries into medicines for patients with serious illnesses. Our mission is to serve patients, and we encompass this with each initiative, goal and task we have in mind!

A career at Amgen is a chance for you to make the most of your education at one of the world's preeminent biotechnology companies. Here, you will work side by side with some of the best minds in the industry and participate in groundbreaking projects to unlock the healing potential of biology.

We are seeking highly talented individuals to join our Human Resources Organization as a summer graduate intern. Interns will be assigned to a role within an HR function (i.e.., HR Business Partner, Total Rewards, Talent, HR Staff Services) and complete timely and relevant projects in support of Amgen’s strategic and tactical goals. Work will be thoughtfully designed to address real business priorities and to provide challenging growth opportunities, exposure to leadership, and a view of the cross-functional nature of a full-time role in HR at Amgen.

Amgen’s 12 week Human Resources Development Program Internship offers meaningful project experiences that will help to accelerate learning and make you an outstanding candidate for our fulltime rotational program. This internship also provides the opportunity to participate in executive and social networking events and community volunteer projects, while providing competitive compensation. Limited relocation, housing and/or transportation allowance may be available for eligible candidates.

Basic Qualifications

Amgen requires that all individuals applying for a grad internship or a co-op assignment at Amgen must meet the following criteria

18 years or older

Graduated with a Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited college or university with a 3.0 minimum GPA or equivalent

Completion as a first year graduate student before internship starts and currently enrolled in a MBA program for a MBA internship OR a Master’s program for a Masters internship OR a PharmD program for a PharmD internship OR PhD for a PhD internship from an accredited college or university

Enrolled in an accredited college or university following the potential internship or co-op assignment

Must not be employed at the time the internship starts

Preferred Qualifications

In process of completing the first year of a Master’s degree in an HR-related field

Minimum Of Two Years Professional Work Experience

Leadership, flexibility, and ability to navigate ambiguous situations

Effective written and oral communication and ability to influence individuals at all levels of the organization

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

Ability to collaborate and partner in a team-based environment to drive outcomes

Demonstrated personal initiative and self-motivation

Willingness and ability to engage proactively in continuous improvement of self and company

Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Only candidates who apply via http //careers.amgen.com/ will be considered

Join Us

If you're seeking a career where you can truly make a difference in the lives of others, a career where you can work at the absolute forefront of biotechnology with the top minds in the field, you'll find it at Amgen.

Amgen, a biotechnology pioneer, discovers, develops and delivers innovative human therapeutics. Our medicines have helped millions of patients in the fight against cancer, kidney disease, rheumatoid arthritis and other serious illnesses.

As an organization dedicated to improving the quality of life for people around the world, Amgen fosters an inclusive environment of diverse, ethical, committed and highly accomplished people who respect each other but compete intensely to win. Together, we live the Amgen values as we continue advancing science to serve patients.

Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Bigger challenges. Bolder ideas. Global impact. At Viasat, we're on a mission to deliver connections with the capacity to change the world. We're the company behind the world's fastest satellite internet service, with technology that's helping to bridge the digital divide and improve life for our customers around the globe. By providing powerful new ways for people to connect with one another, gain greater access to education, entertainment, medical research, commerce, and much more, our team is empowering millions of customers worldwide.

We're growing rapidly and looking for passionate, innovative professionals to join our team and connect the world to more. You'll work in a collaborative and inclusive environment that values diverse perspectives and continuous learning, and provides industry-leading benefits with unmatched opportunities for career growth. Our team is fearless in pursuit of new ideas and uncompromising in our quest to become the world's first truly global Internet Service Provider. Interested in joining our mission? Take a look at career opportunities at Viasat today.

Job Responsibilities

Security Analysts use their secure network and security expertise to reduce risks for our customers by finding, identifying and fixing system vulnerabilities, design issues, security control shortcomings and misconfigurations. You will use advanced techniques including statistics, emerging Cyber Threat Intelligence (CTI) including Indicators of Compromise and inference to actively monitor our networks. This includes reviewing the latest security alerts to determine relevancy, urgency and root cause. You will also participate in various types of threat hunts ranging from daily to quarterly to find and root out evil in our network that was able to bypass our existing security solutions to penetrate our network defenses.

 Our Team 

Our Cybersecurity Operations Center (CSOC) is responsible for defending Viasat and customer networks to make them cyber resilient. It uses a data and intelligence-driven, cognitive approach that continuously learns. This includes a Defensive Cyberspace Operations capability that leverages Security Orchestration Automation and Response to create a force multiplier capable of analyzing and responding to billions of security events per day.We use cutting edge technologies and tools to work towards fully automating Tier 1 security analyst functions so our security analysts can focus on what really matters to our customers.

 Job Opportunity 

Security Analysts serve as the backbone of the Cyber Security Operation Center. They:
 Investigate security incidents and perform forensics investigations  Review asset discovery and vulnerability assessment data  Explore ways to identify stealthy threats that may have found their way inside our network, without detection, using the latest threat intelligence  Leverage emerging threat intelligence to identify affected systems and the scope of the attack  Determine and direct remediation and recovery efforts  Create trouble tickets for alerts that signal an incident and require Incident Response 
 Our Ideal Candidate 

We value curiosity, learning, and adaptability. Our ideal candidate is persistent, has dogged curiosity to get to the root cause, and the ability to remain calm under pressure.

In This Position, You Will

Actively monitor and defend our networks against the most sophisticated cyber-attacks from Advanced Persistent Threats and nation states.

Requirements
 Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering,Cybersecurity Engineering, Information Technology, or Data Science focusing on Cybersecurity or equivalent  Knowledge of computer components and architectures, the functions of various components and peripherals, basic programming concepts, assembly codes, TCP/IP, OSI models, underlying networking protocols, security hardware and software  Ability to script (e.g, Python, PowerShell, etc.)  Ability to understand the entirety of the threat landscape for a particular system and apply the right security technologies where they will be most effective  Ability to clearly explain, demonstrate, and document security issues at a level understandable by less security aware team members  Interest in tracking new vulnerabilities and security threats as they emerge  Ability to travel up to 10% 
 Preferences 
 Certified Ethical Hacker or other cyber relevant certificates (e.g., Cyber Defender, CySA+…)  Demonstrable experience with network mapping tools and network data flows  Experience using penetration testing tools and techniques  Knowledge of malicious activity and malware tactics  Demonstrate knowledge/abilities in one or more of the following:

 Routing protocols like BGP, OSPF, HSRP, VRRP Network based ACL's Switching protocols such as 802.1D, 802.1Q, 802.1ad, QinQ, STP, MSTP Securing VPNs, DMZs, Application Servers, Firewalls and/or database Traffic analysis methods using network monitoring protocols and tools such as Wireshark, nmap, Metasploit, CANVAS or others.

To learn more about this site and other office locations, please click !

Job Summary

It is time to explore “Tech Banking” at SCB, We aim to welcome new grad in ‘Technology” and related fields who expected to graduate in the year 2020. If you are keen in programming and interested in Banking industry, Come to challenge your career with us.

Job Descriptions

fields.company_name: January 2020 New Grad Program - Business Systems Analyst 1
fields.post_html_body:
Epsilon is an all-encompassing global marketing innovator. We provide unrivaled data intelligence and customer insights, world-class technology including loyalty, email and CRM platforms and data-driven creative, activation and execution. With over 40 years in the market, we help Fortune 500 companies across numerous industries better connect with their consumers, online and offline, and improve their marketing, day in and day out. We have been recognized by Forbes as one of "America's Best Employers to Work For," a top company by Fortune Magazine as one of the "100 Best Places to Work for Millennials," and have earned the Ad Age accolade of "#1 U.S. Agency Across all Disciplines" for multiple years.

Epsilon is seeking aBusiness Systems Analyst, 1 (BSA, 1) to participate in our New Grad Program. The BSA,1 will work closely with our clients and internal account/technical teams to understand and implement the client's marketing technology initiatives. The position offers opportunities to become both technically and operationally proficient in both marketing strategy and technology. While every client team is unique, a BSA,1 will get access to a variety of marketing/database technologies such as campaign management tools, analytic tools, coding tools, and proprietary Epsilon technology. A successful BSA,1 candidate will be both tech-savvy while having strong interpersonal skills to relay messages to the client & internal teams.

As a participant in the New Grad Program,you will have the opportunity to fast-track your career with Epsilon. The program includes a 12-week training curriculum (both professional & technical training), a formal mentoring partnership, various networking opportunities (speed networking events, leader meet & greets, group lunches and social events), and long-term career guidance.

Responsibilities May Include (All Or Some) Tasks Below
  Serve as Liaison Communicate with the client teams & internal account/technical teams on a daily basis to implement client marketing strategies
  Requirements Gathering Translate the client's marketing business needs into technical requirements documents.
  Create Documentation Collect and maintain project documentation and ensure that it complies with standards.
  Development & Implementation
 Assist & lead internal team meetings & provide direction to the implementation teams.
 Identify and communicate project related risks and possible solutions. Prioritize project requests and manage client expectations.
 Coordinate integration of new technology initiatives with the overall technical solution platforms.
 Participate and drive product features and development.
    Quality Assurance & Testing Support the creation of plans and test cases. Lead the client teams in user acceptance testing by owning effective triage activities & triage reporting.
  Campaign Delivery Build, execute, and deliver omni-channel marketing campaigns. (direct mail, email, loyalty programs, mobile/social)
  Oversee Implementation & Manage Operations  Proactively identify areas for improved marketing processes, system enhancements, & operational efficiency.
 Identify and research any data discrepancies, escalating issues to other team members when necessary.
  

Qualifications
 Bachelor's degree required (Technical and/or Marketing concentration preferred)
 Desire to learn technology; exposure to database technology is a plus (but not required)
 Excellent listening & communication skills, both verbal and written
 Detail-oriented, able to multi-task and prioritize in a fast-paced environment
 Able to work in a team & build effective relationships, both locally & remotely
 Demonstrated leadership skills
 Self-starter, with strong initiative
  Conditions of Employment
All job offers are contingent upon successful completion of certain background checks which unless prohibited by applicable law may include criminal history checks, employment verification, education verification, drug screens, credit checks, DMV checks (for driving positions only) and fingerprinting.

Great People, Deserve Great Benefits

We know that we have some of the brightest and most talented associates in the world, and we believe in rewarding them accordingly. If you work here, expect competitive pay, comprehensive health coverage, and endless opportunities to advance your career.

About Epsilon

Epsilon® is an all-encompassing global marketing innovator. We provide unrivaled data intelligence and customer insights, world-class technology including loyalty, email and CRM platforms and data-driven creative, activation and execution. Epsilon's digital media arm, Conversant, is a leader in personalized digital advertising and insights through its proprietary technology and trove of consumer marketing data, delivering digital marketing with unprecedented scale, accuracy and reach through personalized media programs. Together, we bring personalized marketing to consumers across offline and online channels, at moments of interest that help drive business growth for brands. Epsilon employs over 8,000 associates in 70 offices worldwide. For more information, visit www.epsilon.com and follow us on Twitter @EpsilonMktg.

Epsilon provides equal employment opportunities without regard to race, color, religion, gender, age, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

fields.company_name: University Grad: Senior Associate Security Engineer
fields.post_html_body:
Electronic Arts Inc. is a leading global interactive entertainment software company. EA delivers games, content and online services for Internet-connected consoles, personal computers, mobile phones and tablets.

 We are EA 

…and we are the world’s leading game company, entertaining millions of people across the globe with the most amazing, immersive interactive software in the industry – how cool is that? Whether you’re into FIFA, Madden Football, Battlefield, Star Wars, The Sims, or Plants vs. Zombies, we’ve got you covered. But making games is hard work, and EA has plans to do even more, connecting players with their friends in new ways and ensuring play continues no matter which device you’re using.

The Challenge Ahead

The Security Engineer is a member of the Verification & Pentest team under the Game & Product Security Engineering group within EA's Information Security department.

As a Security Engineer, your primary job will be to discover vulnerabilities in EA’s games and gaming infrastructure. Your work will help protect our business data, our employee data, and most importantly, our customers.

The security assessments you perform will cover everything from web applications, to network infrastructure, to white-box and black-box reviews of thick clients and servers. In addition to identifying security issues, you’ll need to determine the business risk posed by the vulnerabilities you discover and be able to communicate your findings across teams to both technical and non-technical audiences.

The ideal candidate has a deep understanding of security principles and a passion to learn new technologies, challenge assumptions, and find new ways to solve problems.

Responsibilities
 Consult with and advise EA product teams on remediation options for discovered risks.  Identify issue variants that defeat point fixes, and suggest solutions  Use architecture and design documentation to create security assessment scoping documents and define security test-cases for upcoming product assessments  Articulate technical issues clearly to technical and non-technical partners  Identify needs and drive the development of your security skills and knowledge 

Requirements
 Ability to review and understand code in at least one of C, C++, Java, C#, scripting languages.  Fundamental understanding of CWE Top 25 and OWASP Top 10 vulnerabilities. Ability to discover these vulnerabilities in assessment targets.  Experience with security assessment tools such as Burp Suite, Nessus, nmap, or Wireshark  Knowledge of one or more of cryptography, common authentication and authorisation mechanisms, secure development best practices  Knowledge of operating systems internals for one or more of Windows, Linux, MacOS, iOS, or Android.  Knowledge of one or more of common networking protocols, network architectures, network devices or control mechanisms.  Knowledge of cloud networking and cloud security considerations  Ability to engage and articulate security issues, fixes and choices to technical and non-technical audiences.  Ability to identify knowledge gaps and seek the right sources to close those gaps  Excellent verbal and written English skills, interpersonal skills, and professionalism  Bachelor’s degree or Master’s Degree in Computer Science or Information Security, or equivalent industry experience

fields.post_html_body:
Company Description

About Huawei

Huawei is a leading global provider of information and communications technology (ICT) infrastructure and smart devices. With integrated solutions across four key domains – telecom networks, IT, smart devices, and cloud services – we are committed to bringing digital to every person, home and organization for a fully connected, intelligent world.

At Huawei, innovation focuses on customer needs. We invest heavily in basic research, concentrating on technological breakthroughs that drive the world forward. We have more than 180,000 employees, and we operate in more than 170 countries and regions. Founded in 1987, Huawei is a private company fully owned by its employees.

About Huawei Canada

Huawei Canada helps connect Canadians to world-leading high-speed wireless Internet – and supplies them with cutting-edge smart devices. In partnership with Canadian telecommunications providers, we work to bring the benefits of a reliable and secure digital experience to every person, home and organization, including those in rural and remote areas of the country. Huawei first came to Canada in 2008. Today, the company employs more than 1,100 Canadians in research and development, IT, sales and other fields. Huawei Canada is an active supporter of many charitable and community initiatives from coast to coast.

Job Description

In this role, you will be working as Systems Engineer in a team environment conducting research and development into bleeding edge, next generation ultra-high-speed interfaces and signal integrity systems (aka SerDes, PHY, HSS, wireline transceivers, optical transceivers) in deep submicron FinFET technologies. You will have the opportunity to contribute to industry leading innovation and learn from a team of experts in IC and System Engineering.

Responsibilities
Specific duties include architecture definition, modeling, system level simulation and performance analysis of high speed interfaces and signal integrity systems both on electrical and optical channels.Contribute to architect and drive specifications of key blocks such as sophisticated equalizers and adaptive equalization algorithms, timing recovery, PLLs, ADC-DSP systems, Serializers and Deserializers, optical and wireline transceivers, & forward error correction. Qualifications
PHD or MASc in Electrical Engineering or equivalent degreeStrong, hands-on experience using Matlab & Simulink for system modeling is a mustHands on experience in Reed Solomon (RS) codingClear skills in both written and oral communication, and ability to work effectively and respectfully with diverse teams spanning multiple locations around the world
Assets
DSP or FEC knowledge, digital communications, and real-world design experience is a strong plusBackground in optical or wireline transceivers is a strong plusExperience in deep submicron or FinFET technologies is a plusHands-on knowledge of firmware or software development and test support is a plus

fields.company_name: Physical Design Engineer – New College Grad
fields.post_html_body:
We are now looking for a New College Grad for Physical Design/Timing Engineer.

NVIDIA has continuously reinvented itself over two decades. Our invention of the GPU in 1999 sparked the growth of the PC gaming market, redefined modern computer graphics, and revolutionized parallel computing. More recently, GPU deep learning ignited modern AI — the next era of computing. NVIDIA is a “learning machine” that constantly evolves by adapting to new opportunities that are hard to tackle, which we love to work on, and that matter to the world. This is our life’s work, to amplify human creativity and intelligence.

The Physical Design team is seeking a Timing Engineer to join their growing and dynamic team. You will be responsible for all aspects of physical design and implementation of Graphics processors, SOCs, integrated chipsets, and other ASICs. Make the choice to join us today!

What You Will Be Doing
Responsible for many different aspects of static timing analysis and closure on some of the most complex and challenging integrated circuits being built today. This can include constraint creation and validation, critical path analysis, timing ECO generation, and timing sign-off.You may have the opportunity to tackle related physical tasks such as synthesis, equivalence checking, netlist generation, power and noise analysis, CDC, and functional ECO creation.You may also engage with EDA vendors like Synopsys, Cadence, Mentor, etc. for tool suites such as: Physical Compiler, PrimeTime, dc_shell, Formality, and SPICE.You will an opportunity to interact with a diverse team engineers across different chip functions.Contribute your ideas and experience to help improve our overall methodology and approaches to timing closure (flow and tools development).

What We Need To See
You are pursuing a BS, MS or PhD in Electrical or Computer Engineering with a minimum GPA of 3.5Demonstrate a deep understanding of Logic synthesis, equivalence checking/Formality, static timing analysis, clock/power distribution and analysis, RC extraction and correlation, place and route, placement, routing, circuit design and analysis, crosstalk delay, noise glitch.You have scripting and programming experience using several of the following: Perl, Python, C, C++, TCL, and Make.It is a plus if you have previous internship or work experience in physical design implementation, methodology and/or flow development and automation.Hands-on experience in industry standard EDA tools preferred. Familiarity of Synopsys PrimeTime is also a plus.
NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression , sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

Job Description

At Solar Turbines, we are dedicated to attracting and retaining next generation talent. Our new graduates work
on projects that impact our business and the future of our company. With offices and facilities around the world, our
recruits will collaborate and connect with Solar employees on a global scale.
You will be welcomed into a workforce that powers the future with innovative ideas that you make a reality. Join
our team of experts in engineering, manufacturing and operations, sales, supply chain, environmental health
and safety, human resources and more!
The Engineer Rotation Programs provides the foundation for the future success of Solar Turbines engineers and
the future success of the organization. The purpose of the program is to start the development and training of
the next generation of highly capable and highly competent engineers.
This is a 3-year rotational program for recently graduated engineers. The candidate will spend an extensive period
in training that will focus on a broad exposure to our products and the Customer Service organization.
The training you receive will be a combination of classroom and on-line training, significant hands-on
experience, structured on the job training in the field and mentored controls system training at various Solar
locations including Senawang (MY), San Diego (CA), Mabank (TX) and Desoto (TX). Each phase of the
program emphasises a different aspect of field operations.
Topics covered include
 Safety training Gas turbine package familiarization training Controls system training Customer services experience Engine Overhaul/Repair Power Generation and Gas compression Trouble shooting Structured on the job (Hands on) training at Customer Sites in the Field
This program offers an excellent opportunity to combine formal training with hands on experience in the field at
our district office in Mumbai, India as a Field Service Representative.
This position requires significant travel and interface in customer facilities. Frequent communication with the
customer and technical personnel is required while diagnosing turbine package and balance of plant related
issues. In addition, the successful candidate will be required to work safely and with little supervision in the
field environment while maintaining a high degree of responsibility and professionalism.

Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Mechanical, Electrical, Instrumentation, Aerospace or Related Engineering field.Must have graduated within the last 3 calendar yearsMust be able and willing to travel, relocate, and work overtime.

Preferred Qualifications
Able to work in extreme or adverse environments.High integrity and a high level of self-confidence.Ability to handle stress and communicate in a professional manner.Previous internship/placement or related work experience is beneficial

fields.company_name: New Grad - Open to working on RPA
fields.post_html_body:
We have an exciting opportunity!

We're looking for an individual who would love the opportunity to learn and work as an RPA Developer.
We're open to seeing new grads as well.

This is a permanent full-time opportunity, and training will be provided as well.

Do note that you must be eligible for pass Canadian Security Clearance Level II
The role will be located in Mississauga.

What is RPA?
RPA is a low code software that mimics the work performed by humans across the front, middle and back-office, enabling organizations of all sizes to free up their people from the mundane, repetitive tasks and re-focus them on the value-added work.

RPA is widely accepted as the platform and foundation that will enable organizations, globally, to adopt Artificial Intelligence solutions. Leading research firms predict that by 2025 the RPA market will exceed 3 billion dollars.

Whilst RPA isn’t code-heavy; practical development experience (preferably .NET) is a must.

We also seek individuals who are logical and analytical in their thought process.

For immediate consideration, please send your resume to click apply

Randstad Professionals Canada
Randstad Canada is committed to building a diverse workforce reflective of the diversity of Canada. As a result, we promote employment equity and encourage candidates, especially those who identify as a woman, an Aboriginal person, a person with a disability or a member of a visible minority group, and any others who may contribute to the diversification of our workforce, to apply.

Randstad Canada is also committed to developing an inclusive, barrier-free selection processes and work environments.If contacted in relation to a job opportunity, you should advise your Randstad Representative or your local Randstad branch in a timely fashion of the accommodation measures which must be taken to enable you to be assessed in a fair and equitable manner.Information received relating to accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially.

For all feedback on equity and accommodation needs, please contact your local Randstad Canada Branch.

fields.company_name: Communications System Design - New grad opportunity
fields.post_html_body:
In this role, you will be working as Systems Engineer in a team environment conducting research and development into bleeding edge, next generation ultra-high-speed interfaces and signal integrity systems (aka SerDes, PHY, HSS, wireline transceivers, optical transceivers) in deep submicron FinFET technologies. You will have the opportunity to contribute to industry leading innovation and learn from a team of experts in IC and System Engineering.

Responsibilities

Specific duties include architecture definition, modeling, system level simulation and performance analysis of high speed interfaces and signal integrity systems both on electrical and optical channels.Contribute to architect and drive specifications of key blocks such as sophisticated equalizers and adaptive equalization algorithms, timing recovery, PLLs, ADC-DSP systems, Serializers and Deserializers, optical and wireline transceivers, & forward error correction.

Bigger challenges. Bolder ideas. Global impact. At Viasat, we're on a mission to deliver connections with the capacity to change the world. We're the company behind the world's fastest satellite internet service, with technology that's helping to bridge the digital divide and improve life for our customers around the globe. By providing powerful new ways for people to connect with one another, gain greater access to education, entertainment, medical research, commerce, and much more, our team is empowering millions of customers worldwide.

We're growing rapidly and looking for passionate, innovative professionals to join our team and connect the world to more. You'll work in a collaborative and inclusive environment that values diverse perspectives and continuous learning, and provides industry-leading benefits with unmatched opportunities for career growth. Our team is fearless in pursuit of new ideas and uncompromising in our quest to become the world's first truly global Internet Service Provider. Interested in joining our mission? Take a look at career opportunities at Viasat today.

Job Responsibilities

Contribute on a variety of tasks including proposal writing, system design, system/algorithm simulation, design implementation, and system test and verification of communications systems and components for satellite and optical communications markets. Work closely with small and large teams to develop cutting edge technology with a focus on quality and time to market.

Requirements
 Bachelor's degree or higher in Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Electrical Engineering & Computer Engineering, Engineering Physics, Mathematics, Physics and/ or related field Experience or desire to learn C/C++, Python, Matlab/Simulink, or Java for algorithm modeling, automation, and engineering tool developmentPrevious experience with or exposure to system engineering of satellite communication networks and subsystemsEducational focus on digital signal processing, communication theory, digital logic design, and/or systems engineering

Preferences
 Master's degree or higher in Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Electrical Engineering & Computer Engineering, Engineering Physics, Mathematics, Physics and/ or related field Previous internship experience

To learn more about this site and other office locations, please click !

Transform the way the world runs networks
As a leader in Active Network Intelligence, our solutions enable Service Providers to deliver quality experiences for Internet customers around the world. And that quality of experience is no exception for Sandvine Team Members. Creating great experiences starts with understanding the customer journey, then iterating based on industry trends and user feedback. 
The User Experience team creates great experiences on the front end that demonstrate the industry-leading engineering that powers it. We’re looking for a creative, energetic, and motivated UI “Developer” (designer/developer) to join our team. If you are looking for a challenging and rewarding work experience, then we would like to hear from you. 
We are happy to consider experienced grads or interns for this position. 
The Opportunity: Helping to grow the product vision in alignment with UX strategy, user stories, and industry trends. Collaborating with Product Management and UX leadership to create engaging product prototypes that tell a compelling story Working with data experts to create a data set that will populate a hi-fidelity demo prototype with content that resonates with our customers’ business needs Ensuring all micro-interactions contribute to a consistent UI — utilizing your communication skills to collaborate and deliver on our overall UX strategyMonthly continuous improvement releases aligned with our release strategy Collaborate with stakeholders to understand the user journey and associated data sourcesCommunicate with engineering teams to maintain UI standards from demo to productContribute to a game-changing vision backed by industry-leading technologies 
What You Bring: A passion for user experience with some level of formal education—or equivalent experience—in UI, Product Design or front-end developmentA proactive, customer-centric approach when troubleshooting problems and resolving issues related to the product, process, and tools Attention to the essential UI details of a brand, visual alignment, iconography, constancy of messagingExcellent verbal and written communication skills to communicate with crossfunctional teamsA propensity for interface, interaction design, and visual communications Proficiency with React, React Viz, or Ant Design librariesExperience working with database tools such as PostgreSQLExperience using Git version control, Docker, and Cloud deploymentsFamiliar with Scrum or Kanban project teamsExperience in visualizing data with MapBox a plus Your portfolio demonstrates front end experience and a passion for UI trends and UX strategy Keen eye for UI Design and development: typography, iconography, color, alignment, layout, and interaction details Attention to the subtle details that help tell a great user story
What We Bring: Sandvine inspires passionate people who love what they do. When you join Sandvine, you’ve made an intelligent choice to join an established global company with the nimbleness of a start-up, continually creating new and better ways to exceed our customers’ expectations. It all starts with you. Sandvine offers a fun place to work and an environment where you can make a difference. We look for people who believe in working hard, thinking smart, and having fun in the process. About Sandvine Networks are evolving, and operators need to keep up. At Sandvine, we’re working with innovative customers who are looking to embrace change and constantly improve. By combining analytics, machine learning, and automation, we help hundreds of network operators around the world make their networks run simpler and smarter – all while exceeding their expectations. As a Sandviner, you will take on new challenges, learn from industry leaders, and contribute to creative solutions as part of a growing team that is transforming the way the world runs networks.
Thank-you for your interest in Sandvine. While we’re not able to reach out to everyone who applies, we will contact you if your skills and experience are a match for the role. Sandvine is committed to supporting a culture of inclusion. We welcome and encourage applications from all qualified applicants regardless of race, ethnic origin, religion, age, gender, sexual orientation, ability or disability.
If you have an interview or workplace accommodation request, please contact our Global Talent Acquisition Team at careers@sandvine.com.
